AD_ManipAndFist005.synopsis: An one-shot AD where manip Nestor and his subordinate flaming fists Madigan discuss what are we doing in the barn with him. Manip explains that we reported that there was something dangerous among the donations and we were allowed to take a look together with him.
AD_ManipAndFist005.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_A, Refugee Camp, Big BarnPersuade Nestor to let you in to investigate the donations, and follow him (you can persuade him if you've visited the toymaker's basement, or use: oe WYR_MerchantsHouse_KnowsBasement).

Refugee_10.synopsis: Dandi Thistlepetal, Refugee 10, thinks the camp is well organized.

CharmedKid.synopsis: A refugee camp dialog for the tiefling kid Mirkon who we have saved from the harpies in Act 1 and from the Absolute in Act 2.

Protester_003.synopsis: The small one-liner dialog for one of the angry local anti-refugee protesters.

Refugee_09.synopsis: Otterdance Fenton, Refugee 09, is happy to be part of a community, even if it is a refugee camp.

FlamingFist_001.synopsis: A short dialog for the flaming fist guarding a back door of the Big Barn which holds donations for the refugees. Same dialog will be used in a case of this flaming fist catching the player inside the barn.
FlamingFist_001.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_A, Refugee Camp, 102; 44; -116Make sure it's not being impersonated by Orin and talk to the guard here.

AD_RefugeeChild_04_Tag.synopsis: AD for a refugee children to play when they catch and tag some other kid in a game.

PAD_Handler.synopsis: Shadowheart mentions that she needs to find her handler.

Refugee_15.synopsis: Nealos Bright, Refugee_15, is worried about Gronch, who aided him and his brother to get this far.

Protester_001.synopsis: The small dialog for the local anti-refugee protesters leader.

FlamingFist_005.synopsis: A short dialog for the flaming fist lazing inside of the Big Barn. Same dialog will be used in a case of this flaming fist catching the player inside the barn.

YoungLover_02.synopsis: Bex is happy or sad, depending on the survival of Danis
YoungLover_02.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_ATeleport to S_WYR_RefugeeCamp_YoungLover_02 and talk to Bex

Refugee_07.synopsis: Thuldra Thuldrin, Refugee 07. Trying to stay out of the way and help out.

Refugee_06.synopsis: Refugee_06Sent to the refugee camp due to a logistical error, refugee 06 expresses their frustration

AD_RefugeeChild_01_Tag.synopsis: AD for a refugee children to play when they catch and tag some other kid in a game.

BarnPig.synopsis: A small dialog for the pig in the Big Barn who was donated to the refugees by some local person.

AD_DibbsFamily.synopsis: A repeated sequential AD between the Dibbs family. There's also a dog who can bark from time to time if they refer to it (why wouldn't they, the dog is adorable!).

DibbsDog.synopsis: Dibbs dog knows a war is brewing, and is always vigilant, to keep his masters safe.
DibbsDog.how_to_trigger: Teleport to S_WYR_RefugeeCamp_Dog_01 and talk to the dog

FlamingFistManip.synopsis: The dialog for the Flaming Fist manip who stands near the main entrance of the Big Barn that holds donations for the refugee camp. If any of the other Fists catch the player, they bring them to him for the interrogation.
FlamingFistManip.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_A, Refugee Camp, Big Barn, 62; 43; -114Approach and talk to the NPC.

AD_TieflingRefugees.synopsis: A repeated sequential AD between the tiefling refugees: Zorru, who mysteriously survived and skipped the Act 2, Cerys, Bex and Danis. They could discuss how Zorru survived and got to Baldur's Gate all by himself. He probably is surprised they have survived as well, and could feel guilty not helping them and running away.Cerys or BOTH Bex and Danis may not be present for this dialog to play.

AD_RefugeeChild_02.synopsis: One-liner AD for one of the children who's running around in circles, playing a game of tag.

AD_RefugeeChild_01.synopsis: One-liner AD for one of the children who's running around in circles, playing a game of tag.

Refugee_11.synopsis: Kristeen Hazel, Refugee_11, wants to move to the city, and peferably without her mother in law

Trainee_002.synopsis: A refugee camp dialog for the tiefling kid Ide.

AD_DwarfFamily.synopsis: A repeated sequential AD between a family of dwarves. The mother-in-law (Ramona) and her daughter (Gizelle) are not happy with Garron bringing his new wife (Kristeen) into their family.

FlamingFist_006.synopsis: A short dialog for the female flaming fist caster reluctantly guarding the Big Barn. The barn holds donations for the refugees. Same dialog will be used in a case of this flaming fist catching the player inside the barn.

PAD_NearHandler.synopsis: Shadowheart mentions that she feels her handler is nearby.
PAD_NearHandler.how_to_trigger: 1. Enter BGO_Main_A with Shadowheart2. Enter the refugee camp

PAD_FoundToys.synopsis: This PAD plays when the player enters the Barn's room for donations and notices the crate filled with the adorable toys. If the player has visited the toymaker's basement and read the blackmail latter they know that something is wrong with these toys and we should be careful.

PickpocketTrader.synopsis: Mattis expresses gratitude of having survived the harsh path behind.

Trainee_001.synopsis: A refugee camp dialog for the tiefling kid Umi.

AD_ProtestersAndFist.synopsis: A sequential repeated AD between the anti-refugees protesters and Fist Lochan. NAME NOTE: Rename Protestor_001 to Burgher Elvo. Rename Protestor_002 to Cassolina. Rename Protestor_003 to Fann Thigby.

Dibbs.synopsis: The Dibbs family are scared for the safety of thier dog, but are grateful the dog doesn't experience  the anxiety that comes with this war.

YoungLover_01.synopsis: Danis is happy or sad, depending on the survival of Bex
YoungLover_01.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_ATeleport to S_WYR_RefugeeCamp_YoungLover_01 and talk to Danis

AD_Handler.synopsis: Ferg calls out to Shadowheart as she passes by. He's been instructed to keep watch for her.

SharranInformer.synopsis: Ferg is a Sharran lookout instructed to watch out for Shadowheart but also works as a fence and money launderer for the Sharran cult. Players can convince him to offer his unique and unusual wares for trade.
SharranInformer.how_to_trigger: 1. Go to Refugee camp2. Talk to Ferg

Protester_002.synopsis: The small one-liner dialog for one of the angry local anti-refugee protesters.

FlamingFist_003.synopsis: A short dialog for the flaming fist patroling inside of the Big Barn which holds donations for the refugees. Same dialog will be used in a case of this flaming fist catching the player inside the barn.
FlamingFist_003.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_A, Refugee Camp, Big Barn, 65; 43; -146Talk to Flaming Fist Broadhorn inside the barn

Refugee_08.synopsis: Garron Flintsplitter, Refugee_08, rambles about his journey with his wife, sister and mother.

AD_TraineeKids.synopsis: A repeated sequential AD between two tiefling kids: Ide and Umi, who previously (in Act 2) had a special event with Alfira, where she wrote a song with them together. Maybe they try to sing it again? Or write a new one?

AD_RefugeeChild_04.synopsis: One-liner AD for one of the children who's running around in circles, playing a game of tag.

AD_FlamingFistManip_GivesInstructions.synopsis: A repeated sequential AD for the manip Nestor, where he talks to his flaming fist subordinates regarding the explosive toys we found. They do not respond, so he just gives some general instructions etc. (NOT about finding the criminal)
AD_FlamingFistManip_GivesInstructions.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_A, Refugee Camp, Big BarnTrigger the toys inside the barn, proceed through Nestor's crime dialog peacefully, then leave the barn, walk away from it, then return.

Refugee_13.synopsis: Ramona Flintsplitter, refugee_13, a mother who is not pleased with her son's wife.

BackupLeader.synopsis: Refugee camp dialog for one of the tiefling survivors - Cerys.
BackupLeader.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_A, Refugee Camp, 102; 44; -93Set up tieflings through Debug Book.

FlamingFist_002.synopsis: A short dialog for the flaming fist guarding the Big Barn next to his manip. The barn holds donations for the refugees. Same dialog will be used in a case of this flaming fist catching the player inside the barn.

AD_WoundedRefugeeFriends.synopsis: A repeated sequential AD between the Brights, two refugees whose friend Gronch was wounded when trying to protect them from the absolutists. They want to continue moving, but they are afraid their friend needs some more time to recover.

DibbsWife.synopsis: Small dialog for the NPC in the refugee camp - she in her husband Fortuno have a nice adorable dog Biscotti.

HobgoblinOutcast.synopsis: One-liner dialog for Ghibklug, a sleeping hobgoblin in the refugee camp. He wakes up if talked to, so in this dialog he is already standing.

AD_PickpocketAndCharmedKids.synopsis: A repeated sequential AD between two tiefling kids: Mattis and Mirkon. They stand near the big barn that holds donations for the refugees. The kids might be a bit mischievous.
AD_PickpocketAndCharmedKids.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_A, Refugee Camp, near the big barn

AD_RefugeeChild_02_Tag.synopsis: AD for a refugee children to play when they catch and tag some other kid in a game.

AD_RefugeeChild_03_Tag.synopsis: AD for a refugee children to play when they catch and tag some other kid in a game.

PAD_RecoveredRing.synopsis: Player comments on how the recovered part of the ring fits with the other half they recovered (Either the ring or the gem meant to fit in it)

AD_RefugeeChild_03.synopsis: One-liner AD for one of the children who's running around in circles, playing a game of tag.

Refugee_14.synopsis: Gregory Bright, Refugee_14, is worried about Gronch, who aided him and his brother to get this far.

Tiefling_011.synopsis: Zorru is furious after being left behind by Zevlor who is supposed to lead them
Tiefling_011.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_ATeleport to:S_WYR_RefugeeCamp_Point_Tiefling_011 5d65381b-a949-4034-9252-d0cbb9cac1ccIf Zorru is not there use ReCon: oe WYR_TieflingRefugee_SpawnSpeak to Zorru

Refugee_12.synopsis: Gizelle Flintsplitter, Refugee_12, can't stand her brother's wife.

WoundedRefugee.synopsis: Dialogue for Gronch the wounded refugee.

AD_FlamingFistManip_AfterToys.synopsis: A repeated sequential AD for the manip Nestor, where he talks to himself after it was revealed that there were explosives inside donated toys. He stays near the chest (or in the place where it was, if the player blew it up). Note: toys may be taken from the crate or the crate itself could be exploded, so we should not refer to them rather than vaguely.
AD_FlamingFistManip_AfterToys.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_A, Refugee Camp, Big BarnTrigger the toys inside the barn, proceed through Nestor's crime dialog (don't get into a prison!)

FlamingFist_004.synopsis: A short dialog for the Flaming Fist standing near the group of anti-refugee protesters. One-liner basically.

Dead_MurderVictim.synopsis: Speak with dead with a refugee, Garrett,  that was murdered by a Sharran fence operating in the refugee camp in Wyrm's Crossing after he created a scene.
Dead_MurderVictim.how_to_trigger: 1. goto 46.351; 14.342; 65.9422. Cast speak with dead on dead refugee

AD_ManipAndFist005_3.speaker: Fist Madigan
AD_ManipAndFist005_3.text: Is everything all right, Manip Nestor? Sir?

AD_ManipAndFist005_2.speaker: Manip Nestor
AD_ManipAndFist005_2.text: There's been a report of dangerous contraband in the donations, and we're going to check it out.

AD_ManipAndFist005_0.speaker: Fist Madigan
AD_ManipAndFist005_0.text: Why? All these goods have already been checked in.

AD_ManipAndFist005_1.speaker: Manip Nestor
AD_ManipAndFist005_1.text: I didn't ask for your opinion, Fist. Fall in and do your job.

Refugee_10_0.speaker: Dandi Thistlepetal
Refugee_10_0.text: Could be worse. I could still be hiding in a ditch while a squad of Absolutist goblins marches past.

Refugee_10_1.speaker: Dandi Thistlepetal
Refugee_10_1.text: To be fair, for a miserable collection of shabby hovels jam-packed with wretched refugees, this place isn't bad at all.

CharmedKid_0.speaker: Mirkon
CharmedKid_0.text: Oh, hello. I remember you, sort of. Thanks, I think? Bye!
CharmedKid_0.context: NodeContext: chirpy but distracted - doesn't really pay attention to grown-ups.

CharmedKid_1.speaker: Mirkon
CharmedKid_1.text: Oh, hi. If you're here to save me again, I don't really need to be saved right now. Good thing, huh? Bye!

Protester_003_9.speaker: Ricks Garven
Protester_003_9.text: We could be next! Incinerated in the name of the Absolute! It's all happening!
Protester_003_9.context: NodeContext: A confusing mixture of fear and excitement

Protester_003_12.speaker: Ricks Garven
Protester_003_12.text: An explosion! It's happening! The agents of the Absolute are here!
Protester_003_12.context: NodeContext: A confusing mixture of fear and excitement

Protester_003_13.speaker: Ricks Garven
Protester_003_13.text: Oh gods, please just leave me alone. I'll keep the Absolute's secret, I swear.
Protester_003_13.context: NodeContext: Scandalised (and gripped by own his conspiracy theory)

Protester_003_14.speaker: Ricks Garven
Protester_003_14.text: You see them over there? Refugees? Pah! Naught but a cover. I know what they really are...

Protester_003_11.speaker: Ricks Garven
Protester_003_11.text: Dyed-in-the-wool agents of the Absolute. Mark my words.
Protester_003_11.context: NodeContext: Keen to show he knows the truth; basically a conspiracy theorist

Protester_003_0.speaker: Player
Protester_003_0.text: You think all of the refugees are hardcore Absolutists?

Protester_003_4.speaker: Ricks Garven
Protester_003_4.text: There's probably only a handful of rotten apples among them.

Protester_003_1.speaker: Ricks Garven
Protester_003_1.text: But you know what they say about rot... It spreads quickly. Ruins the whole bunch.

Protester_003_15.speaker: Player
Protester_003_15.text: You're right. They could be anywhere.

Protester_003_7.speaker: Player
Protester_003_7.text: I'll mark more than your words. Praise the Absolute.

Protester_003_3.speaker: Ricks Garven
Protester_003_3.text: AH! Oh gods oh gods - look, let me live, and I'll say nothing. I swear it. Just leave me and mine alone.

Protester_003_6.speaker: Ricks Garven
Protester_003_6.text: Oh come off it now, that's not funny. The Absolute is a real, genuine threat.

Protester_003_16.speaker: Player
Protester_003_16.text: Then you should butcher the heretics. Here, I'll even help you.

Protester_003_10.speaker: Ricks Garven
Protester_003_10.text: I mean, I hardly think that's... necessary.
Protester_003_10.context: NodeContext: deeply weirded out, player has just suggested they slaughter a group of people

Protester_003_8.speaker: Player
Protester_003_8.text: The close-minded drivel of someone who's never left the city. Typical.

Protester_003_5.speaker: Ricks Garven
Protester_003_5.text: How dare you. There's nothing at all wrong with this city - or at least, there wasn't before this... incursion.

Protester_003_20.speaker: Ricks Garven
Protester_003_20.text: Be vigilant, now. These Absolutists could be anywhere.
Protester_003_20.context: NodeContext: Scandalised (and gripped by own his conspiracy theory)

Refugee_09_0.speaker: Otterdance Fenton
Refugee_09_0.text: Never been to Baldur's Gate, not sure how many gnomes are there. Sure hope I find some kind of gnomish community behind those walls.

Refugee_09_1.speaker: Otterdance Fenton
Refugee_09_1.text: Glad to see you! Glad to see anybody, really. It was a lonely road getting here through those abandoned farmlands, and I'm a sociable sort.

FlamingFist_001_14.speaker: Fist Rowan
FlamingFist_001_14.text: Why are you talking to me when you have a whole barn to explore?

FlamingFist_001_15.speaker: Fist Rowan
FlamingFist_001_15.text: Thought I would've noticed some explosive teddy bears lying around - guess not. Well done, I suppose.

FlamingFist_001_18.speaker: Fist Rowan
FlamingFist_001_18.text: Give me one good reason why you're here - preferably in one word or less.

FlamingFist_001_30.speaker: Fist Rowan
FlamingFist_001_30.text: Right, off to the manip with you.

FlamingFist_001_22.speaker: Fist Rowan
FlamingFist_001_22.text: At least you're honest. The manip'll deal with you.

FlamingFist_001_17.speaker: Fist Rowan
FlamingFist_001_17.text: What...? Well, here's a word for you: manip. Come on - let's go and see him.

FlamingFist_001_19.speaker: Player
FlamingFist_001_19.text: Attack before he raises the alarm.

FlamingFist_001_21.speaker: Fist Rowan
FlamingFist_001_21.text: Oh look, it's the barn enthusiast.

FlamingFist_001_23.speaker: Fist Rowan
FlamingFist_001_23.text: Gods, imagine if a kid had gotten hold of one of those bears...
FlamingFist_001_23.context: NodeContext: Genuinely concerned in his own gruff way

FlamingFist_001_26.speaker: Fist Rowan
FlamingFist_001_26.text: They let you into the barn? Well, try not to get overexcited.

FlamingFist_001_29.speaker: Fist Rowan
FlamingFist_001_29.text: Thinking of trying to get into this barn? Don't.

FlamingFist_001_27.speaker: Player
FlamingFist_001_27.text: Why not? I quite like barns.

FlamingFist_001_9.speaker: Fist Rowan
FlamingFist_001_9.text: Not this one you won't. Now piss off.

FlamingFist_001_2.speaker: Player
FlamingFist_001_2.text: I'm just curious about what's inside it.

FlamingFist_001_16.speaker: Fist Rowan
FlamingFist_001_16.text: Could be anything, couldn't it? Now off you pop.

FlamingFist_001_10.speaker: Player
FlamingFist_001_10.text: I was merely taking a stroll and happened to wander by.

FlamingFist_001_13.speaker: Player
FlamingFist_001_13.text: Someone got up on the wrong side of the bed this morning.

FlamingFist_001_8.speaker: Fist Rowan
FlamingFist_001_8.text: They're all wrong. Now go and be somewhere else.

FlamingFist_001_31.speaker: Fist Rowan
FlamingFist_001_31.text: You like this barn a bit too much, don't you? I think you need to calm down in the cells.
FlamingFist_001_31.context: NodeContext: Irritated by the player's shenanigans

FlamingFist_001_7.speaker: Player
FlamingFist_001_7.text: Allow yourself to be taken to prison.

AD_RefugeeChild_04_Tag_0.speaker: Billy
AD_RefugeeChild_04_Tag_0.text: Haha, you're it, try and catch me!

Refugee_05_3.speaker: Sister Hegira
Refugee_05_3.text: If I hear speak of 'their city' and 'strays' one more time... I may need to ask Ilmater's forgiveness.

Refugee_05_6.speaker: Sister Hegira
Refugee_05_6.text: Lord on the Rack give me patience...

Refugee_05_1.speaker: Sister Hegira
Refugee_05_1.text: These protesters keep harassing the refugees. It's horrid.

Refugee_05_0.speaker: Sister Hegira
Refugee_05_0.text: I just hope the Ilmater temple opens up aid again soon. We need their help here.

Refugee_05_4.speaker: Player
Refugee_05_4.text: ...And let my mind endure in times of strife.

Refugee_05_5.speaker: Sister Hegira
Refugee_05_5.text: His Most Holy Tears be blessed. Thank you - it is nice to pray with another faithful. Especially right now.

PAD_Handler_0.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_Handler_0.text: The city is close now - my former peers will be watching, no doubt. Waiting for my return.

PAD_Handler_2.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_Handler_2.text: We should do what we can to find them - what they know could help us.

PAD_Handler_1.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_Handler_1.text: The city is close now - followers of Lady Shar will watching, no doubt. Waiting for my return.

Refugee_15_0.speaker: Nealos Bright
Refugee_15_0.text: I don't know, maybe Greg has some ideas about how we can help Gronch get inside the walls. I can't think straight anymore.

Refugee_15_1.speaker: Nealos Bright
Refugee_15_1.text: We've got to get Gronch into the city, but he's in no shape to travel. I wonder... what if we hid him in a big barrel and nailed it shut? ...Nah.

Protester_001_0.speaker: Saer Grotpoll
Protester_001_0.text: Did you hear that noise? The flames? I knew these refugees were up to no good. I knew it.

Protester_001_11.speaker: Saer Grotpoll
Protester_001_11.text: Ah - have you returned to fight the good fight? Always room for one more!
Protester_001_11.context: NodeContext: Hoping the player might see things from his perspective/rally to him

Protester_001_18.speaker: Player
Protester_001_18.text: Your fight is far from good.

Protester_001_34.speaker: Player
Protester_001_34.text: Remind me what the 'fight' is actually about?

Protester_001_6.speaker: Player
Protester_001_6.text: Someone's added explosives to toys meant for refugees. Sound familiar?

Protester_001_14.speaker: Saer Grotpoll
Protester_001_14.text: Baldurians! Stand with me against this tide that threatens to overwhelm us.

Protester_001_30.speaker: Fist Lochan
Protester_001_30.text: Please just go home - you're ruining a perfectly uneventful posting with this nonsense.
Protester_001_30.context: NodeContext: Weary/annoyed; trying to wrangle anti-refugee protestors

Protester_001_17.speaker: Saer Grotpoll
Protester_001_17.text: The Flaming Fists are supposed to protect this good city, but they allow trash and vermin to take our homes and goods!

Protester_001_12.speaker: Saer Grotpoll
Protester_001_12.text: YOU! You're a true Baldurian, I can tell. You must understand why we need to keep these strays out of our city.
Protester_001_12.context: NodeContext: Try to rally the player to his cause

Protester_001_10.speaker: Halsin
Protester_001_10.text: I thought cities were supposed to welcome folk of all walks of life. Clearly I was mistaken.

Protester_001_9.speaker: Player
Protester_001_9.text: Someone's added explosives to toys meant for refugees. Sound familiar?

Protester_001_16.speaker: Saer Grotpoll
Protester_001_16.text: What exactly are you implying? You bleeding hearts are always painting us as monsters - We don't want them dead.

Protester_001_44.speaker: Saer Grotpoll
Protester_001_44.text: We just want Baldur's Gate to be for Baldurians. Let Waterdeep give this riffraff shelter.

Protester_001_38.speaker: Player
Protester_001_38.text: Baldur's Gate is the most diverse city in all of Faerûn. We should take them in with pride.

Protester_001_13.speaker: Player
Protester_001_13.text: Refugees aren't 'strays'. They are people, and they need help.

Protester_001_23.speaker: Saer Grotpoll
Protester_001_23.text: Another bleeding heart - piss off and take it elsewhere.

Protester_001_15.speaker: Player
Protester_001_15.text: Exactly! Out with these interlopers, I say.

Protester_001_21.speaker: Saer Grotpoll
Protester_001_21.text: Yes, friend! We must stand together against these parasites.
Protester_001_21.context: NodeContext: Pleased the player sees things his way

Protester_001_37.speaker: Saer Grotpoll
Protester_001_37.text: I can only hope we turf them out before they devour all our food like locusts.
Protester_001_37.context: NodeContext: Pleased the player sees things his way/triumphant

Protester_001_5.speaker: Player
Protester_001_5.text: I'll have you know I was born and bred in Baldur's Gate.

Protester_001_33.speaker: Saer Grotpoll
Protester_001_33.text: Oh. My apologies - now I hear you speak, I of course realise you're a local.
Protester_001_33.context: NodeContext: Apologetic (but trying not to sound TOO apologetic to maintain face)

Protester_001_22.speaker: Player
Protester_001_22.text: Baldurian? Your accent's Rivingtonian - that hardly counts.

Protester_001_4.speaker: Saer Grotpoll
Protester_001_4.text: Excuse me? I was born inside the city walls - a Baldurian through and through!

Protester_001_25.speaker: Saer Grotpoll
Protester_001_25.text: Wherever you're from, clearly they don't teach manners.

Protester_001_36.speaker: Player
Protester_001_36.text: The army on your doorstep will slay Baldurians and refugees alike. You must stand together.

Protester_001_20.speaker: Player
Protester_001_20.text: Sorry to disappoint you, but I'm actually not a Baldurian.

Protester_001_8.speaker: Saer Grotpoll
Protester_001_8.text: Now I've heard you speak, that's very apparent. Please, stop wasting my time.

Protester_001_42.speaker: Player
Protester_001_42.text: I'm a born and bred Baldurian, how dare you!

Protester_001_39.speaker: Saer Grotpoll
Protester_001_39.text: I know an outsider when I see one - you've probably never even heard of the Upper City, let alone been there.

Protester_001_2.speaker: Saer Grotpoll
Protester_001_2.text: Oh. Another 'visitor', I see. Listen, we keep letting the likes of you in, soon there'll be no room left for any of us true Baldurians!

Protester_001_19.speaker: Saer Grotpoll
Protester_001_19.text: I only hope nobody of importance was hurt in the explosion.

Protester_001_26.speaker: Saer Grotpoll
Protester_001_26.text: You and I have nothing more to say to one another.

FlamingFist_005_3.speaker: Fist Madigan
FlamingFist_005_3.text: I see you enjoyed our little chat so much you snuck back for another.
FlamingFist_005_3.context: NodeContext: A little disappointed in the player

FlamingFist_005_17.speaker: Fist Madigan
FlamingFist_005_17.text: Come, we can continue our scintillating conversation on the way to your jail cell.

FlamingFist_005_8.speaker: Player
FlamingFist_005_8.text: Allow yourself to be taken to prison.

FlamingFist_005_4.speaker: Fist Madigan
FlamingFist_005_4.text: I've got to say - wouldn't have expected such solid work solving a case from a civvie. Well done.

FlamingFist_005_5.speaker: Fist Madigan
FlamingFist_005_5.text: This is quite clearly a restricted area, citizen. You can mull over your mistake in a cell - come with me.

FlamingFist_005_6.speaker: Fist Madigan
FlamingFist_005_6.text: OI! What in Helm's most holy name are you doing here, citizen?
FlamingFist_005_6.context: NodeContext: Stern and forceful; clearly loves her job

FlamingFist_005_0.speaker: Player
FlamingFist_005_0.text: There's something wrong with the donations. I'm investigating.

FlamingFist_005_22.speaker: Fist Madigan
FlamingFist_005_22.text: Oh, investigating are you? Well, my deepest apologies, detective.

FlamingFist_005_2.speaker: Fist Madigan
FlamingFist_005_2.text: Pull the other one, pisspot. You're coming with me, we'll see what Manip Nestor has to say about this.

FlamingFist_005_1.speaker: Player
FlamingFist_005_1.text: I just wanted to see what was inside this barn.

FlamingFist_005_12.speaker: Fist Madigan
FlamingFist_005_12.text: And I just want to see what Manip Nestor has to say to you. Come on - with me.

FlamingFist_005_18.speaker: Fist Madigan
FlamingFist_005_18.text: Well, I have to applaud the rather bold strategy. But alas, it is uniquely my business.

FlamingFist_005_15.speaker: Player
FlamingFist_005_15.text: This looked like the only place around here worth stealing from.

FlamingFist_005_14.speaker: Fist Madigan
FlamingFist_005_14.text: An honest thief? City still finds ways to surprise after all these years...
FlamingFist_005_14.context: NodeContext: Genuinely pleased the player owned up

FlamingFist_005_9.speaker: Fist Madigan
FlamingFist_005_9.text: Let's you and I go and have a chat with Manip Nestor, hm?

FlamingFist_005_10.speaker: Fist Madigan
FlamingFist_005_10.text: Seems we were patrolling around a powder keg. Glad I didn't get burned up.

FlamingFist_005_13.speaker: Fist Madigan
FlamingFist_005_13.text: Should consider enlisting. The Fist could with more folk like you in our ranks.

FlamingFist_005_20.speaker: Fist Madigan
FlamingFist_005_20.text: You best not piss away Manip Nestor's good graces. I hear Wyrm's Rock Prison is rather cold this time of year.
FlamingFist_005_20.context: NodeContext: Slightly wary of the player's motives

YoungLover_02_0.speaker: Bex
YoungLover_02_0.text: Your face... your face is familiar. But it isn't Danis' face. His is the only face I want to see, and I... I'll never see it again.

YoungLover_02_1.speaker: Bex
YoungLover_02_1.text: We made it through Hell - twice! I know now that as long as Danis and I stick together, we can do anything.

Refugee_04_1.speaker: Dorrich Manne
Refugee_04_1.text: I hate this place. Can't even soap my forearms in peace...

Refugee_04_2.speaker: Dorrich Manne
Refugee_04_2.text: Washin' my pits, washin' my pits, this is the song when I'm -
Refugee_04_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: he's washing his pitsNodeContext: happily washing his pits while singing, and stops when he noticed the player looking

Refugee_04_0.speaker: Dorrich Manne
Refugee_04_0.text: OI! Can a bloke not get any bleedin' privacy round here? Buncha perverts, the lot of you!

Refugee_07_0.speaker: Thuldra Thuldrin
Refugee_07_0.text: Don't pay me any mind, now! I'm just trying to make sure everyone gets fed.

Refugee_06_7.speaker: Tinker Nayzeem
Refugee_06_7.text: Piss off, would you? I've got some 'papers' I have to file to get in. Apparently. Bloody bleeding bureaucrats...

Refugee_06_12.speaker: Tinker Nayzeem
Refugee_06_12.text: Heads will roll for this. This... this transgression! This injustice!

Refugee_06_2.speaker: Player
Refugee_06_2.text: I know, the way they treat refugees around here is terrible.

Refugee_06_14.speaker: Tinker Nayzeem
Refugee_06_14.text: I don't give a shit about all that, it's how I've been treated which is the real travesty!

Refugee_06_6.speaker: Tinker Nayzeem
Refugee_06_6.text: Oh, you poor, naive soul. Let me tell you a story.

Refugee_06_16.speaker: Player
Refugee_06_16.text: The Divine works in mysterious ways. I bet it'll all work out in the end.

Refugee_06_5.speaker: Tinker Nayzeem
Refugee_06_5.text: 'Mysterious' is an understatement. Beggars bloody belief, more like.

Refugee_06_8.speaker: Tinker Nayzeem
Refugee_06_8.text: A perfectly respectable businessman wants to bring his, well, business into this 'fine' city, and what do they do?

Refugee_06_4.speaker: Player
Refugee_06_4.text: I'm guessing they didn't let you in.

Refugee_06_0.speaker: Tinker Nayzeem
Refugee_06_0.text: Well, I was going to sell the finest alchemical tinkerings the Gate had ever seen. But the bureaucrats had other ideas.

Refugee_06_10.speaker: Tinker Nayzeem
Refugee_06_10.text: They talked some absolute horse-bollocks about 'papers' and 'correct filing procedures' - and threw me in this slum.

Refugee_06_20.speaker: Halsin
Refugee_06_20.text: Imagine upending someone's life in the name of bureaucracy. People are out of touch here.

Refugee_06_15.speaker: Tinker Nayzeem
Refugee_06_15.text: I should be loins-deep in Sharess' Caress by now, not waddling about in filth.

Refugee_06_19.speaker: Tinker Nayzeem
Refugee_06_19.text: Exactly what I expect from this absolute hole of a city. No one cares. Where's the hospitality, I ask you? WHERE?

BarnPig_12.speaker: Pig
BarnPig_12.text: I say, terribly decent of you to come over and exchange pleasantries.

BarnPig_0.speaker: Player
BarnPig_0.text: You're one of the most impressive pigs I've ever seen!

BarnPig_8.speaker: Pig
BarnPig_8.text: Oh, how kind of you to say! I have been growing my bristles out - it's something of an art, you see.
BarnPig_8.context: NodeContext: Grateful for the compliment; attempting to be modest

BarnPig_15.speaker: Player
BarnPig_15.text: What are you doing in that pen?

BarnPig_2.speaker: Pig
BarnPig_2.text: I was donated, apparently. Presumably for an emotional support role - a therapy pig, if you will.
BarnPig_2.context: NodeContext: A little bewildered by it all but very pleased with the cabbages

BarnPig_3.speaker: Pig
BarnPig_3.text: That'll be why I'm kept so well fed - they doubtless want me performing at my tip-top!

BarnPig_6.speaker: Player
BarnPig_6.text: Seen anything interesting while you've been here?

BarnPig_10.speaker: Pig
BarnPig_10.text: Folk come, folk go - it's a little dull, to be frank.
BarnPig_10.context: NodeContext: Keen to convey the dullness

BarnPig_9.speaker: Pig
BarnPig_9.text: The room next door has rather reeked of late, though - and that's coming from me! Hah!

BarnPig_16.speaker: Pig
BarnPig_16.text: Salutations once more, old stick - always a treat to have visitors.

BarnPig_5.speaker: Player
BarnPig_5.text: You're a cute little pig, aren't you?

BarnPig_13.speaker: Player
BarnPig_13.text: Well, at least you seem happy.

AD_DibbsFamily_0.speaker: Fortuno Dibbs
AD_DibbsFamily_0.text: Here we are, Grisselda, all in one piece!

AD_DibbsFamily_2.speaker: Grisselda Dibbs
AD_DibbsFamily_2.text: I wish the cult hadn't burnt our farm, though. At least we got Biscotti out of that burning barn!

AD_DibbsFamily_1.speaker: Fortuno Dibbs
AD_DibbsFamily_1.text: Just a little singed, eh, Biscotti?

AD_DibbsFamily_6.speaker: Fortuno Dibbs
AD_DibbsFamily_6.text: We're farmers, Griss - what are we going to do in the city?

AD_DibbsFamily_5.speaker: Grisselda Dibbs
AD_DibbsFamily_5.text: Pretty sure they'll need labourers to shore up the walls, Forty.

AD_DibbsFamily_3.speaker: Fortuno Dibbs
AD_DibbsFamily_3.text: You're right. Hadn't thought of that.

AD_DibbsFamily_8.speaker: Grisselda Dibbs
AD_DibbsFamily_8.text: Have you found someplace we can wash our clothes yet?

AD_DibbsFamily_4.speaker: Fortuno Dibbs
AD_DibbsFamily_4.text: What will we wear while we're washing them? We only got away with what we have on.

AD_DibbsFamily_7.speaker: Grisselda Dibbs
AD_DibbsFamily_7.text: These clothes make me itch. That's a bigger issue than modesty, dear.

DibbsDog_7.speaker: Biscotti
DibbsDog_7.text: Look, I know you're not going to say it, so you might as well be on your way.

DibbsDog_22.speaker: Biscotti
DibbsDog_22.text: I'm a... Oh, goodness! You said it! Wondrous day! I am a good dog.

DibbsDog_20.speaker: Biscotti
DibbsDog_20.text: You can come back. I like you.

DibbsDog_9.speaker: Biscotti
DibbsDog_9.text: Ooh... Oh gods... Are they going to say it? What happens if they don't say it...

DibbsDog_27.speaker: Biscotti
DibbsDog_27.text: ...Fetch? Oh gods. No no no no...

DibbsDog_30.speaker: Player
DibbsDog_30.text: Who's a good dog? You're a good dog.

DibbsDog_14.speaker: Biscotti
DibbsDog_14.text: YES! OH GOODNESS YES! I am a good dog... Fantastic stuff.

DibbsDog_25.speaker: Biscotti
DibbsDog_25.text: Oh yes, you're lovely. You can come back.

DibbsDog_26.speaker: Narrator
DibbsDog_26.text: *The dog seems wary, sniffing you intently.*

DibbsDog_11.speaker: Player
DibbsDog_11.text: Expose your teeth to the dog and growl.

DibbsDog_16.speaker: Player
DibbsDog_16.text: Offer your hand to the dog to sniff, being careful to not spook it.

DibbsDog_1.speaker: Narrator
DibbsDog_1.text: *The dog sniffs your hand and seems more at ease.*

DibbsDog_28.speaker: Biscotti
DibbsDog_28.text: Ohohohoho... Here we go, here it comes...

DibbsDog_8.speaker: Biscotti
DibbsDog_8.text: YES! YES! YESSSSS! Amazing. Perfect. No notes.

DibbsDog_0.speaker: Biscotti
DibbsDog_0.text: What a tease. I can't believe it. Maybe next time...

FlamingFistManip_8.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_8.text: You might be a nuisance but at least neither of us got blown up, eh?
FlamingFistManip_8.context: NodeContext: Genuinely grateful, possibly even a little warm (if gruff about it)

FlamingFistManip_11.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_11.text: Can't keep out of trouble, can you?
FlamingFistManip_11.context: NodeContext: Weary annoyance at the player

FlamingFistManip_14.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_14.text: I heard you tracked down the man responsible for those explosive toys - good work.
FlamingFistManip_14.context: NodeContext: Genuinely grateful (if gruff about it)

FlamingFistManip_157.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_157.text: Now give me some room - I need to make sure the rest of these donations are safe.
FlamingFistManip_157.context: NodeContext: Dismissive of the player but concerned about the potentially explosive donations

FlamingFistManip_132.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_132.text: You try and find whoever is responsible for this.
FlamingFistManip_132.context:
NodeContext: The line should be copied from 00532ddb-1204-f29d-9375-a1f685965969, N206.
> Resignation; really doesn't have time for this shit himself

FlamingFistManip_40.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_40.context: NodeContext: Very gruff and grudging apology

FlamingFistManip_51.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_51.text: What was that?! Are you all right?
FlamingFistManip_51.context: NodeContext: Has just been shocked by an explosion; genuinely concerned for a moment despite everything

FlamingFistManip_107.speaker: Player
FlamingFistManip_107.text: As all right as I can be after being next to a fiery explosion.

FlamingFistManip_74.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_74.text: From the sound of that explosion, I'm not surprised.

FlamingFistManip_104.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_104.context: NodeContext: Still gruffly concerned/a little shellshocked

FlamingFistManip_205.speaker: Player
FlamingFistManip_205.text: I was just looking at the donations and some of them blew up.

FlamingFistManip_168.speaker: Player
FlamingFistManip_168.text: So it turns out those toy bears were explosive.

FlamingFistManip_49.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_49.text: What? Those are children's toys - which means if a child had picked one up... I don't want to think about it.

FlamingFistManip_75.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_75.text: How do I know you're not the one who planted those explosives?

FlamingFistManip_129.speaker: Player
FlamingFistManip_129.text: Because I've already found and dealt with the real culprit: Arfur Gregorio. You're lucky I was here.

FlamingFistManip_69.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_69.text: You might be a nuisance but at least neither of us got blown up, eh?
FlamingFistManip_69.context: NodeContext: Genuinely grateful, possibly even a little warm (if gruff about it)

FlamingFistManip_202.speaker: Player
FlamingFistManip_202.text: I just wanted to see what was inside the barn.

FlamingFistManip_3.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_3.text: That's not good enough. You're under arrest.
FlamingFistManip_3.context: NodeContext: Resignation/annoyance at the player having made more work for him

FlamingFistManip_183.speaker: Player
FlamingFistManip_183.text: I almost died in the explosion myself! I want to find whoever's responsible.

FlamingFistManip_161.speaker: Player
FlamingFistManip_161.text: Why would I disarm my own explosives? I just want to find whoever's responsible.

FlamingFistManip_0.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_0.text: All right. I guess it can't hurt. I'll check up on the rest of the goods. You try and find whoever is responsible for this.
FlamingFistManip_0.context: NodeContext: Resignation; really doesn't have time for this shit himself

FlamingFistManip_114.speaker: Player
FlamingFistManip_114.text: I was sent by the Council to check up on your operation.

FlamingFistManip_103.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_103.text: I had a feeling something was wrong in the barn - I wanted to make sure nobody got hurt. Take a look if you must.
FlamingFistManip_103.context: NodeContext: Resignation (and slight genuine concern at possibly being reported)

FlamingFistManip_90.speaker: Player
FlamingFistManip_90.text: Activate the toy and toss it to him.

FlamingFistManip_198.speaker: Player
FlamingFistManip_198.text: Activate the toy and toss it to him.

FlamingFistManip_201.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_201.text: It stinks of smokepowder in here...

FlamingFistManip_199.speaker: Player
FlamingFistManip_199.text: Look at me - have my eyebrows been singed off?

FlamingFistManip_125.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_125.text: Well, you're still talking, so you can't be that bad.
FlamingFistManip_125.context: NodeContext: Gruffly relieved the player is okay despite everything

FlamingFistManip_53.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_53.text: The hells are you doing in here?
FlamingFistManip_53.context: NodeContext: Angry at the player's trespassing

FlamingFistManip_56.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_56.text: Show me where these explosive toys are, then.
FlamingFistManip_56.context: NodeContext: Suspicious/clearly doesn't quite believe the player

FlamingFistManip_57.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_57.text: Gods - any one of us could've been blown to smithereens.

FlamingFistManip_58.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_58.text: What was that? Stay here - I'll take a look.
FlamingFistManip_58.context: NodeContext: Alert/listening/authoritative after hearing something be disarmed

FlamingFistManip_61.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_61.text: I don't need you standing here gawking, thanks.
FlamingFistManip_61.context: NodeContext: Dismissive/irritated by the player's presence

FlamingFistManip_67.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_67.context: NodeContext: Weary at seeing the player again

FlamingFistManip_82.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_82.context: NodeContext: A little bored; he's been doing this all day

FlamingFistManip_99.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_99.text: Do you not have eyes? The refugees.

FlamingFistManip_15.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_15.text: If you don't have anything to donate, you can get going.

FlamingFistManip_83.speaker: Player
FlamingFistManip_83.text: I need to get into the barn - right now. Something dangerous might be among the donations.

FlamingFistManip_79.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_79.text: I'm going to let you through because I don't want to take any risks. But you'd better not be lying.

FlamingFistManip_159.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_159.text: Nice try. But nothing gets past us. Now move along.

FlamingFistManip_172.speaker: Player
FlamingFistManip_172.text: Did you know that somebody's donated a load of toys filled with explosives?

FlamingFistManip_96.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_96.text: Thank you. I'm sure your contribution will be greatly appreciated.

FlamingFistManip_182.speaker: Player
FlamingFistManip_182.text: I want to donate some supplies.

FlamingFistManip_78.speaker: Player
FlamingFistManip_78.text: I'd like to take the donation into the barn myself.

FlamingFistManip_108.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_108.text: Well... if you must. I suppose it saves me the walk. But if you're going to do it, hurry up.
FlamingFistManip_108.context: NodeContext: Slightly suspicious but willing to allow it (and slightly irritated by the player's presence of course)

FlamingFistManip_163.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_163.text: I'm not letting you into the barn. Give me what you've got to donate or leave.
FlamingFistManip_163.context: NodeContext: Increasingly annoyed with the player's antics

FlamingFistManip_153.speaker: Player
FlamingFistManip_153.text: Maybe people would donate more if you weren't so rude.

FlamingFistManip_30.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_30.text: Nothing to donate? Then, again, do kindly leave.

FlamingFistManip_47.speaker: Player
FlamingFistManip_47.text: Actually, I think I'll hang onto it for now.

FlamingFistManip_175.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_175.text: Very giving of you. Now go waste someone else's time.

FlamingFistManip_128.speaker: Player
FlamingFistManip_128.text: I can heal folk, if that's any use.

FlamingFistManip_145.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_145.text: These folks' empty bellies and purses need healing more than anything, priest.

FlamingFistManip_70.speaker: Player
FlamingFistManip_70.text: It looks like you have plenty already.

FlamingFistManip_134.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_134.text: You wouldn't be saying that if you'd seen this inventory - or how many refugees we have here.

FlamingFistManip_64.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_64.text: Very funny. You can make a donation to the refugees or you can leave.

FlamingFistManip_7.speaker: Player
FlamingFistManip_7.text: I'll make a donation - what do you need?

FlamingFistManip_126.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_126.text: Food, sundries, gold - these poor refugee sods need all the help they can get.

FlamingFistManip_88.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_88.text: Are you gonna search the barn or what?
FlamingFistManip_88.context: NodeContext: Annoyed at the player's faffing around/wasting time

FlamingFistManip_97.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_97.text: You - turn around and toddle your way right back out of here.

FlamingFistManip_13.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_13.text: Everything in this barn has been donated for the refugees - not you. Now piss off.

FlamingFistManip_54.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_54.text: I'm doing my job - you can window-shop elsewhere.

FlamingFistManip_167.speaker: Player
FlamingFistManip_167.text: What kind of things have people donated?

FlamingFistManip_4.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_4.text: Food. Sundries. Toys, even. What would you expect for people who've lost everything?
FlamingFistManip_4.context: NodeContext: Clearly appreciative of the donations for the refugees but soon wary of/annoyed by the player again after the -

FlamingFistManip_121.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_121.text: Now are you going to clear off or not?

FlamingFistManip_138.speaker: Player
FlamingFistManip_138.text: Did you know that somebody's donated a load of toys filled with explosives?

FlamingFistManip_92.speaker: Player
FlamingFistManip_92.text: Why does a barn need the Flaming Fist to protect it?

FlamingFistManip_173.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_173.text: In case little weasels like you come sniffing around.
FlamingFistManip_173.context: NodeContext: Wary of the player/annoyed at them

FlamingFistManip_197.speaker: Player
FlamingFistManip_197.text: Is there anything I can do to help?

FlamingFistManip_131.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_131.text: Not unless you want to make a donation.
FlamingFistManip_131.context: NodeContext: Irritated at the player's questions

FlamingFistManip_180.speaker: Player
FlamingFistManip_180.text: Why do you care about the refugees so much?

FlamingFistManip_44.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_44.text: And you don't after all they've been through? And with the army of the Absolute at their backs?
FlamingFistManip_44.context: NodeContext: Slightly incredulous at the question; annoyed at the player's ignorance

FlamingFistManip_50.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_50.text: If you can't see it, I'm not going to waste my time explaining it to you.
FlamingFistManip_50.context: NodeContext: Pretty annoyed now; wants the player to piss off so he doesn't have to deal with them

FlamingFistManip_91.speaker: Player
FlamingFistManip_91.text: I'd like to make a donation to the refugees, actually.

FlamingFistManip_200.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_200.text: Guess you're not all bad. Give it here and I'll make sure it's kept safely with the other donations.
FlamingFistManip_200.context: NodeContext: Gruff and a little wary still (does genuinely want donations for the refugees underneath it all)

FlamingFistManip_94.speaker: Player
FlamingFistManip_94.text: Ah, I meant I'd bring my donation later.

FlamingFistManip_151.speaker: Player
FlamingFistManip_151.text: Is this really going to help the refugees?

FlamingFistManip_102.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_102.text: Look around you - these poor sods need all the help they can get.
FlamingFistManip_102.context: NodeContext: Gruff sympathy for the refugees (but still annoyed at the player's ignorance)

FlamingFistManip_115.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_115.text: You sure? This lot have been through enough without your ignorance.
FlamingFistManip_115.context: NodeContext: Mild incredulousness and irritation at the player

FlamingFistManip_46.speaker: Player
FlamingFistManip_46.text: Fist [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53] reporting for duty, SIR! I was asked to check on the barn.

FlamingFistManip_133.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_133.text: And I wasn't informed? Bloody meddling Flames... What are you still looking at? You've got a job to do, hop to it!
FlamingFistManip_133.context: NodeContext: first part whispered to self, on "what" realises the player's still listening

FlamingFistManip_33.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_33.text: Hang about - your uniform's not regulation. Neither are those weapons...

FlamingFistManip_110.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_110.text: What are you still flapping your lips at me for? Get on with it.

FlamingFistManip_139.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_139.text: Got something else to donate, have you?
FlamingFistManip_139.context: NodeContext: Brusque (but not annoyed; the player DID donate before)

FlamingFistManip_146.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_146.text: So you were sniffing round the barn, were you? Why?
FlamingFistManip_146.context: NodeContext: Suspicious and annoyed by the player having trespassed

FlamingFistManip_10.speaker: Player
FlamingFistManip_10.text: Did you know that somebody's donated a load of toys filled with explosives?

FlamingFistManip_141.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_141.text: What? Who'd put explosives in toys?

FlamingFistManip_85.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_85.text: Very well. Show me these explosive toys, then.
FlamingFistManip_85.context: NodeContext: Suspicious/clearly doesn't quite believe the player

FlamingFistManip_142.speaker: Player
FlamingFistManip_142.text: I was investigating a crime - I think some of the donations might be dangerous.

FlamingFistManip_36.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_36.text: What? Dangerous? Is this a joke?

FlamingFistManip_189.speaker: Player
FlamingFistManip_189.text: So you're fine with innocent people getting hurt just because you won't own up to your guards' negligence?

FlamingFistManip_45.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_45.text: Look, we're doing our best here - we're just stretched pretty thin, in case you hadn't noticed.
FlamingFistManip_45.context: NodeContext: Incredulous/a little angry (but also a little cowed by the player's words)

FlamingFistManip_43.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_43.text: Fine, you can look around. But if there's any funny business, it'll be straight to Wyrm's Rock with you.
FlamingFistManip_43.context: NodeContext: Quiet but very real threat

FlamingFistManip_191.speaker: Player
FlamingFistManip_191.text: Please, go and check. It won't take much of your time, but it could save lives.

FlamingFistManip_155.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_155.text: Fine, I'll look - but I'm doing it for the refugees, not you.
FlamingFistManip_155.context: NodeContext: Admonishing; the latter is referring to the player's actions

FlamingFistManip_118.speaker: Player
FlamingFistManip_118.text: I was just curious about what's inside this barn.

FlamingFistManip_116.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_116.text: This is a barn, not a museum - now get gone.

FlamingFistManip_192.speaker: Player
FlamingFistManip_192.text: All right, all right - I was looking for stuff to steal.

FlamingFistManip_120.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_120.text: Appreciate the candour. Gonna have to arrest you, though.
FlamingFistManip_120.context: NodeContext: Weary and annoyed at the player having made more work for him

FlamingFistManip_68.speaker: Player
FlamingFistManip_68.text: I'll be honest with you: I'm hot on the trail of my client's prize pig Lulabelle.

FlamingFistManip_55.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_55.text: A... pig? You're looking for a pig?
FlamingFistManip_55.context: NodeContext: Incredulous - but listening as he's been persuaded to

FlamingFistManip_156.speaker: Player
FlamingFistManip_156.text: Oh, yes - and she's a wily one. There's not a sty that can hold her.

FlamingFistManip_150.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_150.text: You ought to be careful - I hear pigs eat people if given the chance.

FlamingFistManip_41.speaker: Player
FlamingFistManip_41.text: Lulabelle's been stolen. I've been told to check every barn in the city - no exceptions.

FlamingFistManip_77.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_77.text: Well, there is a pig here, I suppose.
FlamingFistManip_77.context: NodeContext: Matter of fact - but then resigned

FlamingFistManip_34.speaker: Player
FlamingFistManip_34.text: She's an extremely rare Chionthar Swordback - I don't need to tell you how much they're worth.

FlamingFistManip_170.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_170.text: I'm not one for animal husbandry - but I know Rivington certainly has its enthusiasts.
FlamingFistManip_170.context: NodeContext: Is clearly wary of said enthusiastics/thinks they're weird

FlamingFistManip_147.speaker: Player
FlamingFistManip_147.text: I'm sorry, but if I tell you any more I could be putting Lulabelle's life in danger. She has piglets depending on her.

FlamingFistManip_1.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_1.text: Piglets? Oh. Well. I hope you find her in time. For the little ones' sakes.

FlamingFistManip_154.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_154.text: You can have a look. Just don't touch anything.
FlamingFistManip_154.context: NodeContext: Relenting - think it's weird but will allow it

FlamingFistManip_42.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_42.context: NodeContext: A little amused by the player's attempt

FlamingFistManip_93.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_93.text: I'll let the boys at Wyrm's Rock deal with you.
FlamingFistManip_93.context: NodeContext: Resignation/matter of fact; takes no pleasure in this, it's just required

FlamingFistManip_169.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_169.text: Right, that's it - off to the cells with you.
FlamingFistManip_169.context: NodeContext: Has had it with the player's bullshit by this point

FlamingFistManip_178.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_178.text: Did I not just tell you you weren't allowed in here? What are you doing?
FlamingFistManip_178.context: NodeContext: Angry at the player's trespassing

FlamingFistManip_195.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_195.text: What are you...? Explosives? In toys?

FlamingFistManip_196.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_196.text: Who's that rummaging around in there? Show yourself!

FlamingFistManip_164.speaker: Manip Nestor
FlamingFistManip_164.text: You have two seconds to explain yourself before you're under arrest.

FlamingFistManip_89.speaker: Player
FlamingFistManip_89.text: I found a load of toy bears rigged to explode - but don't worry, I disarmed them.

FlamingFistManip_87.speaker: Player
FlamingFistManip_87.text: Allow yourself to be taken to prison.

AD_TieflingRefugees_0.speaker: Cerys
AD_TieflingRefugees_0.text: Zorru! You made it here all on your own?

AD_TieflingRefugees_13.speaker: Zorru
AD_TieflingRefugees_13.text: It was touch and go. Some close calls - the cult have claimed every road between Baldur's Gate and Elturgard.

AD_TieflingRefugees_2.speaker: Zorru
AD_TieflingRefugees_2.text: But from what you tell me, I had it easy compared to the rest of you.

AD_TieflingRefugees_5.speaker: Cerys
AD_TieflingRefugees_5.text: We made it. I always knew we would, but I wish everyone were here.

AD_TieflingRefugees_1.speaker: Zorru
AD_TieflingRefugees_1.text: We should have an Exiles Feast to commemorate those we lost.

AD_TieflingRefugees_14.speaker: Danis
AD_TieflingRefugees_14.text: Supplies are short, but I can scrape enough together for everyone to have a bite of something solid.

AD_TieflingRefugees_12.speaker: Zorru
AD_TieflingRefugees_12.text: Even if we only have tankards of river-water to raise, we'll drink to their memory.

AD_TieflingRefugees_7.speaker: Zorru
AD_TieflingRefugees_7.text: So many more could have survived, if we - if I - had done the right things.

AD_TieflingRefugees_8.speaker: Danis
AD_TieflingRefugees_8.text: Don't take that on yourself. You know who's really responsible.

AD_TieflingRefugees_4.speaker: Bex
AD_TieflingRefugees_4.text: You did what you could, Zor. I'm sure you did.

AD_TieflingRefugees_10.speaker: Danis
AD_TieflingRefugees_10.text: Zorru! You made it here on your own? How?

AD_TieflingRefugees_11.speaker: Zorru
AD_TieflingRefugees_11.text: I've heard Alfira made her way into the city.

AD_TieflingRefugees_9.speaker: Cerys
AD_TieflingRefugees_9.text: Bards can talk their way out of trouble as well as into it.

AD_TieflingRefugees_6.speaker: Bex
AD_TieflingRefugees_6.text: She sent a message - she's at the Elfsong Tavern. Hopefully making herself comfortable.

AD_TieflingRefugees_3.speaker: Zorru
AD_TieflingRefugees_3.text: Glad at least one of us is doing well.

AD_TieflingRefugees_15.speaker: Bex
AD_TieflingRefugees_15.text: We've lost so many since Elturel.

AD_RefugeeChild_01_0.speaker: Steffy
AD_RefugeeChild_01_0.text: You can't catch me, you can't catch me!

Refugee_11_0.speaker: Kristeen Hazel
Refugee_11_0.text: Gods! Camping with the mother-in-law has been utter hell. Maybe I should just go on ahead into the city without her. Scouting, like.

Refugee_11_1.speaker: Kristeen Hazel
Refugee_11_1.text: The old crone is watching me like a drunk eyes her bottle. I'll never ditch her at this rate.

AD_DwarfFamily_0.speaker: Gizelle Flintsplitter
AD_DwarfFamily_0.text: Kristeen didn't clean the cookware, Mother Mona.

AD_DwarfFamily_2.speaker: Ramona Flintsplitter
AD_DwarfFamily_2.text: Again? Garron, you know the rule: we cook, your wife cleans.

AD_DwarfFamily_1.speaker: Garron Flintsplitter
AD_DwarfFamily_1.text: Aw, it's only a couple of pots. I'll do it.

AD_DwarfFamily_6.speaker: Ramona Flintsplitter
AD_DwarfFamily_6.text: Kristeen is pretty, son, but can't she help out a bit more?

AD_DwarfFamily_3.speaker: Garron Flintsplitter
AD_DwarfFamily_3.text: Now, now, mind your tongues. Leave Kristeen to me.

AD_DwarfFamily_8.speaker: Ramona Flintsplitter
AD_DwarfFamily_8.text: How did the winesack get empty, Garron?

AD_DwarfFamily_4.speaker: Garron Flintsplitter
AD_DwarfFamily_4.text: I bet somebody drank it, Ma! Might even have been me.

AD_DwarfFamily_7.speaker: Gizelle Flintsplitter
AD_DwarfFamily_7.text: You're no sot. I'd put my money on Kristeen.

FlamingFist_006_5.speaker: Fist Varone
FlamingFist_006_5.text: Stop! This place is off-limits - and you're off to a cell.

FlamingFist_006_6.speaker: Fist Varone
FlamingFist_006_6.text: 'Spose the Manip had the right idea, letting you poke around. Good job finding those explosives.

FlamingFist_006_8.speaker: Fist Varone
FlamingFist_006_8.text: I can see you over there, you know. What are you doing?

FlamingFist_006_0.speaker: Player
FlamingFist_006_0.text: There's dangerous things in here I need to investigate!

FlamingFist_006_20.speaker: Fist Varone
FlamingFist_006_20.text: I bet there are. Come on - let's see what Nestor thinks about these 'dangerous things'.
FlamingFist_006_20.context: NodeContext: Clearly doesn't believe the player; sarcastic

FlamingFist_006_1.speaker: Player
FlamingFist_006_1.text: Just taking a peek inside this barn, is all - I didn't realise it wasn't allowed.

FlamingFist_006_4.speaker: Fist Varone
FlamingFist_006_4.text: It is not. But I'll let Nestor teach you the rules.

FlamingFist_006_15.speaker: Player
FlamingFist_006_15.text: All right, all right - you got me. Now what?

FlamingFist_006_3.speaker: Fist Varone
FlamingFist_006_3.text: We go and have a little chat with Nestor. Well, you do.

FlamingFist_006_9.speaker: Player
FlamingFist_006_9.text: Attack before she raises the alarm.

FlamingFist_006_10.speaker: Fist Varone
FlamingFist_006_10.text: Thank Tyr the Manip found those explosive toys. Who knows what could've happened...

FlamingFist_006_13.speaker: Fist Varone
FlamingFist_006_13.text: Not sure why you're poking around here. Just smells of pig piss.

FlamingFist_006_14.speaker: Fist Varone
FlamingFist_006_14.text: Look - you found the explosives. Grand. Surely you've no reason to keep bothering me.

FlamingFist_006_16.speaker: Fist Varone
FlamingFist_006_16.text: Not sure why you were so keen to get in the barn, but if the Manip says so...

FlamingFist_006_18.speaker: Fist Varone
FlamingFist_006_18.text: Back again? Did you not learn the first time? Right - off to the cells with you.
FlamingFist_006_18.context: NodeContext: Angry; the player is really pushing their luck now

FlamingFist_006_2.speaker: Player
FlamingFist_006_2.text: Allow yourself to be taken to prison.

FlamingFist_006_19.speaker: Fist Varone
FlamingFist_006_19.text: Be on your way, citizen. Got a lot to keep my eye on round here.

PAD_NearHandler_0.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_NearHandler_0.text: If I was a Sharran lookout, this is the sort of place I'd wait around.

PAD_FoundToys_0.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundToys_0.text: The toymaker's letter mentioned tampered-with toys. Let's be careful.
PAD_FoundToys_0.context:
InternalNodeContext: "These are the toys that were donated by the toymaker! We should be careful with them."
We didn't know they had explosives in them. We only read the note about them having something inside, which sounded dangerous. But now we look at them and see - indeed, something is wrong with them. We can't use Arfur's name, only the toymaker (not merchant!)

PAD_FoundToys_1.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundToys_1.text: Aw - these toy bears are adorable.
PAD_FoundToys_1.context: InternalNodeContext: "Ah, those toys are adorable! I just want to squeeze them!" We just comment on the toys being there, attracting the player.

PickpocketTrader_2.speaker: Mattis
PickpocketTrader_2.text: Pardon if my eyes are all saucer-like. I didn't realise Baldur's Gate was so big.

PickpocketTrader_11.speaker: Player
PickpocketTrader_11.text: It's unnerving to see a city almost as large as a great forest.

PickpocketTrader_28.speaker: Mattis
PickpocketTrader_28.text: I prefer cities to forests - pull a con on a squirrel, and all you get is nuts.

PickpocketTrader_27.speaker: Player
PickpocketTrader_27.text: Big and dangerous. Watch yourself, kid.

PickpocketTrader_25.speaker: Mattis
PickpocketTrader_25.text: Dangerous? It's a goldmine. So many pockets to pick.

PickpocketTrader_33.speaker: Mattis
PickpocketTrader_33.text: Elturel. It wasn't near as big as the Gate even before half of it burned up in the Hells.

PickpocketTrader_24.speaker: Mattis
PickpocketTrader_24.text: You can say that again... So many pockets to pick.

PickpocketTrader_0.speaker: Mattis
PickpocketTrader_0.text: Wait, I know you! You're the reason some of us got here in one piece. Thanks!

PickpocketTrader_34.speaker: Mattis
PickpocketTrader_34.text: And you're in luck, because we're having a special sale on some of the choice items I picked up on our way here. Fancy stuff. Wanna see?

PickpocketTrader_10.speaker: Player
PickpocketTrader_10.text: Tell me these items aren't stolen from the goods donated to the refugees.

PickpocketTrader_29.speaker: Mattis
PickpocketTrader_29.text: Don't be a goose! They couldn't be - bloody Flaming Fists are guarding that barn like it was a bank.

PickpocketTrader_30.speaker: Mattis
PickpocketTrader_30.text: But even if they were liberated from the barn, all profits go to the refugees anyway, so it's legit, right?

PickpocketTrader_15.speaker: Mattis
PickpocketTrader_15.text: I heard you helped a refugee family stay in the home they found. Good for you! As a trader, I'm going to look for a place, too.

PickpocketTrader_22.speaker: Mattis
PickpocketTrader_22.text: You did me a real favour clearing all those ghouls out of Moonrise.

PickpocketTrader_23.speaker: Mattis
PickpocketTrader_23.text: That old bone-bag Ketheric had some fancy junk stashed behind all the cobwebs and piles of gore.

PickpocketTrader_6.speaker: Player
PickpocketTrader_6.text: What do you think of Baldur's Gate?

PickpocketTrader_19.speaker: Mattis
PickpocketTrader_19.text: Wish I could tell you. We're stuck out here, but most of the action is beyond Wyrm's Crossing.

PickpocketTrader_16.speaker: Mattis
PickpocketTrader_16.text: Heard Mol made it inside already. Figures she'd not only wiggle her way out of Moonrise, but also slip into the city ahead of the rest of us.

PickpocketTrader_12.speaker: Mattis
PickpocketTrader_12.text: Didn't you? Figured we only got the scraps you didn't have the strength to carry.

PickpocketTrader_14.speaker: Mattis
PickpocketTrader_14.text: Still - we got some decent stuff. Made a nice change from picking through your dusty pockets.

PickpocketTrader_1.speaker: Mattis
PickpocketTrader_1.text: And in case you're thinking of trying to scam me out of my hard-earned loot, think again. I already sold it.

PickpocketTrader_35.speaker: Player
PickpocketTrader_35.text: Show me these 'fancy' items you have on offer. Anything magical?

PickpocketTrader_20.speaker: Mattis
PickpocketTrader_20.text: Would I try to fool a sharpy like you? Have a look!

PickpocketTrader_31.speaker: Mattis
PickpocketTrader_31.text: Hello again. Looking for something different? You've come to the right merchant!

Trainee_001_0.speaker: Umi
Trainee_001_0.text: They got me signed up to learn to make pots, which is dumb. I'd rather learn how to kill cultists. And I bet you'd back me up on that.

Trainee_001_1.speaker: Umi
Trainee_001_1.text: They got me signed up to learn to make pots, which is dumb. I'd rather learn how to kill cultists. And I bet you'd back me up on that.

AD_ProtestersAndFist_0.speaker: Saer Grotpoll
AD_ProtestersAndFist_0.text: The refugees can't stay here in Rivington! They're a danger to all of us.

AD_ProtestersAndFist_8.speaker: Mandii Harvestmoon
AD_ProtestersAndFist_8.text: They've got diseases! And any one of them could be a spy for the Absolute!

AD_ProtestersAndFist_2.speaker: Fist Lochan
AD_ProtestersAndFist_2.text: Back off and return to your homes. That's an order.

AD_ProtestersAndFist_1.speaker: Saer Grotpoll
AD_ProtestersAndFist_1.text: Why don't you protect us instead of these scruffy outlanders?

AD_ProtestersAndFist_6.speaker: Saer Grotpoll
AD_ProtestersAndFist_6.text: They're beggars and criminals, and we won't have them!

AD_ProtestersAndFist_3.speaker: Ricks Garven
AD_ProtestersAndFist_3.text: Their kids broke my window, the scum!

AD_ProtestersAndFist_5.speaker: Fist Lochan
AD_ProtestersAndFist_5.text: File a report and I'm sure the manip will deal with it.

AD_ProtestersAndFist_7.speaker: Saer Grotpoll
AD_ProtestersAndFist_7.text: You're coddling these vagabonds and don't give a rat's arse about honest citizens!

AD_ProtestersAndFist_10.speaker: Fist Lochan
AD_ProtestersAndFist_10.text: I'm not paid to debate with civilians.

AD_ProtestersAndFist_4.speaker: Saer Grotpoll
AD_ProtestersAndFist_4.text: No, we pay taxes for you to protect us - not these intruders!

AD_ProtestersAndFist_9.speaker: Fist Lochan
AD_ProtestersAndFist_9.text: I'm paid to take down troublemakers. So don't make trouble.

Dibbs_9.speaker: Fortuno Dibbs
Dibbs_9.text: No, I'm afraid I must insist you do not pet the hound. I know he's very attractive, but it does startle him so.

Dibbs_11.speaker: Fortuno Dibbs
Dibbs_11.text: If you've never had a hound yourself, I'd highly recommend it. Does wonders to distract from this horrible Absolute business.

Dibbs_17.speaker: Fortuno Dibbs
Dibbs_17.text: No, I'm afraid I must insist you do not pet the hound.

Dibbs_22.speaker: Grisselda Dibbs
Dibbs_22.text: My love, you can't keep being so rude to strangers. It is JUST a dog.

Dibbs_20.speaker: Fortuno Dibbs
Dibbs_20.text: All the grabbing and touching startles poor Biscotti. I will not apologise for caring about my boy.

Dibbs_2.speaker: Player
Dibbs_2.text: Bit presumptuous - I never said I wanted to pet your dog.

Dibbs_6.speaker: Fortuno Dibbs
Dibbs_6.text: Oh, trust me, your eyes say it all. Everyone wants to pet him.

Dibbs_15.speaker: Player
Dibbs_15.text: Either way - he's a fine-looking hound.

Dibbs_0.speaker: Fortuno Dibbs
Dibbs_0.text: Isn't he just? I'm so very glad they let animals in the camp. Means Biscotti can be kept away from that awful war.

Dibbs_25.speaker: Grisselda Dibbs
Dibbs_25.text: Oh yes, as long as the dog is okay, he's happy. Give me strength...

Dibbs_14.speaker: Player
Dibbs_14.text: If simple petting startles the dog, I can only imagine how stressful this camp is.

Dibbs_21.speaker: Fortuno Dibbs
Dibbs_21.text: Well, the kids can be a touch grabby... but it's better than being out there.

Dibbs_12.speaker: Grisselda Dibbs
Dibbs_12.text: Whatever the dog thinks, being here is much better than being out there. Right, my dear?

Dibbs_4.speaker: Fortuno Dibbs
Dibbs_4.text: Well, the children can be a touch grabby, but... yes. You're quite right, my darling.

Dibbs_10.speaker: Fortuno Dibbs
Dibbs_10.text: War is no place for a precious little baby like Biscotti, after all.

Dibbs_8.speaker: Player
Dibbs_8.text: Dogs are very sensitive to emotion. If you relax, the dog might, too.

Dibbs_13.speaker: Grisselda Dibbs
Dibbs_13.text: Good luck. I've been saying that for the past decade.

Dibbs_24.speaker: Fortuno Dibbs
Dibbs_24.text: Look, if I don't remain vigilant, something could happen to poor Biscotti. I'd never forgive myself.

YoungLover_01_0.speaker: Danis
YoungLover_01_0.text: Bex died. Bex is dead. I'm alive, but for what? I'm no one without Bex.

YoungLover_01_1.speaker: Danis
YoungLover_01_1.text: We made it alive to Baldur's Gate! Almost, anyway, but I can't complain. When I look at Bex and realise she's safe, it's hard not to weep from joy.

AD_Handler_0.speaker: Ferg Drogher
AD_Handler_0.text: Young lady - Shadowheart - a word, if you will.
AD_Handler_0.context: NodeContext: Calling out to someone he's been ordered to keep watch for. Very briefly breaking his cover story to get her attention

SharranInformer_36.speaker: Ferg Drogher
SharranInformer_36.text: If you're looking for companionship, I hear they can cater to almost every taste in Sharess' Caress. I'm not on offer, unfortunately.

SharranInformer_77.speaker: Player
SharranInformer_77.text: You mentioned you had wares to trade?

SharranInformer_45.speaker: Ferg Drogher
SharranInformer_45.text: I took you for one of them for a moment. The refugees, that is.

SharranInformer_49.speaker: Ferg Drogher
SharranInformer_49.text: You're a recent arrival for sure, still bearing dust from the road... but you have something they lack. Dignity.

SharranInformer_52.speaker: Ferg Drogher
SharranInformer_52.text: These wretches have nowhere to call home, nothing to live off but what they carry, and nobody to help them but themselves... and me, of course.

SharranInformer_47.speaker: Ferg Drogher
SharranInformer_47.text: Charity is a luxury. Fickle, occasional gestures from guilty hearts. I run a business.

SharranInformer_90.speaker: Ferg Drogher
SharranInformer_90.text: You'd be shocked by the sort of things they bring with them. Gold and jewels they can't easily exchange. Heirlooms, rarities, sentimental items - even cremation urns...

SharranInformer_2.speaker: Ferg Drogher
SharranInformer_2.text: Alas, you cannot eat grandmother's ashes, nor can you easily trade a golden candelabra for a bowl of soup. That is where I come in - liquidity. Their heirlooms, for my gold.

SharranInformer_94.speaker: Player
SharranInformer_94.text: I have an acquaintance you might be more willing to deal with. Her name is Shadowheart.

SharranInformer_70.speaker: Ferg Drogher
SharranInformer_70.text: Is that so? Well perhaps you should retrieve her then.

SharranInformer_22.speaker: Player
SharranInformer_22.text: So you buy their heirlooms and valuables at a low rate? Genius - I applaud you.

SharranInformer_63.speaker: Ferg Drogher
SharranInformer_63.text: A pity more don't share your open mind. I always say it's just business, but some don't see it that way.

SharranInformer_67.speaker: Player
SharranInformer_67.text: You're taking advantage of the desperate.

SharranInformer_60.speaker: Halsin
SharranInformer_60.text: A carrion bird would have more dignity. This city feeds on those that need it most.
SharranInformer_60.context: NodeContext: Bitter. Seeing evidence of the unfortunate being taken advantage of.

SharranInformer_89.speaker: Ferg Drogher
SharranInformer_89.text: An exchange of objects, nothing more. We all lose everything in the end.

SharranInformer_29.speaker: Narrator
SharranInformer_29.text: *While it's an odd philosophy for a racketeer - the sentiment would fit a follower of the Nightbringer perfectly.*

SharranInformer_3.speaker: Narrator
SharranInformer_3.text: *A curious philosophy. Better suited to a follower of the Shar then some common racketeer.*

SharranInformer_57.speaker: Player
SharranInformer_57.text: And what do you do with all these goods you're acquiring?

SharranInformer_53.speaker: Ferg Drogher
SharranInformer_53.text: There is an enterprise within the city that I help to support. I know I said I wasn't given to charity, but this place is dear to my heart.

SharranInformer_37.speaker: Ferg Drogher
SharranInformer_37.text: I'd tell you more, but they value discretion above all. As do I.

SharranInformer_44.speaker: Player
SharranInformer_44.text: This gemstone you sell bought seems to be a perfect fit for a ring I found on a dead body...

SharranInformer_17.speaker: Ferg Drogher
SharranInformer_17.text: Is that so? What a remarkable coincidence... or perhaps not.

SharranInformer_32.speaker: Ferg Drogher
SharranInformer_32.text: These are desperate people - who is to say what lengths some of them may have gone to, just to earn the money to survive?

SharranInformer_16.speaker: Ferg Drogher
SharranInformer_16.text: A tragedy, really - but we must not judge. Perhaps I could show you some of my special goods to take your mind off this ugliness?

SharranInformer_79.speaker: Player
SharranInformer_79.text: Sure, show me what you have.

SharranInformer_51.speaker: Player
SharranInformer_51.text: You're a little too eager to brush off that dead body.

SharranInformer_6.speaker: Ferg Drogher
SharranInformer_6.text: Of course I am. Dead bodies are bad for business - as are people asking the wrong sort of question.
SharranInformer_6.context: NodeContext: Vaguest hint of a threat

SharranInformer_68.speaker: Ferg Drogher
SharranInformer_68.text: Now. would you like to see what I have to offer, or would you like to leave? I'll be quite content, either way.

SharranInformer_96.speaker: Player
SharranInformer_96.text: This gemstone I bought seems to be a perfect fit for a ring I found on a dead body...

SharranInformer_92.speaker: Player
SharranInformer_92.text: So, how long have you worshipped Shar?

SharranInformer_78.speaker: Ferg Drogher
SharranInformer_78.text: Perhaps you are cannier than I first gave credit to be. I have some very special wares reserved for exclusive clientele... but I think you've earned a peek.

SharranInformer_20.speaker: Player
SharranInformer_20.text: That's it? You're just a merchant?

SharranInformer_0.speaker: Ferg Drogher
SharranInformer_0.text: Just a merchant. At least look at what's on offer before you embarrass yourself.

SharranInformer_58.speaker: Player
SharranInformer_58.text: There wares are too exotic to have been purchased from refugees, surely. Who's your supplier?

SharranInformer_56.speaker: Ferg Drogher
SharranInformer_56.text: Trade secrets. But I can guarantee you that nothing I have to offer was stolen - it was all given happily and willingly. Every last item.
SharranInformer_56.context: NodeContext: Amused by a private joke. His claim is technically true

SharranInformer_87.speaker: Player
SharranInformer_87.text: What about that ring? Seems that was stolen.

SharranInformer_55.speaker: Ferg Drogher
SharranInformer_55.text: Well in that case, I can only assume whoever stole it then gave it to me willingly.

SharranInformer_5.speaker: Ferg Drogher
SharranInformer_5.text: Dangerous places, camps like these. According to Baldur's Mouth, you never know who might be a cut-throat.
SharranInformer_5.context: NodeContext: Slippery smile. 'Yeah I killed him, but good luck proving it'

SharranInformer_59.speaker: Player
SharranInformer_59.text: It isn't just about gold for you, is it? There's more this that you're letting on...

SharranInformer_91.speaker: Ferg Drogher
SharranInformer_91.text: You're like a dog with a bone, aren't you?

SharranInformer_64.speaker: Ferg Drogher
SharranInformer_64.text: My, your imagination runs hot, doesn't it? Perhaps you should turn to poetry, or offer your services to Baldur's Mouth. I hear those rag traders enjoy a bit of fiction.

SharranInformer_71.speaker: Player
SharranInformer_71.text: A slippery fellow. Perhaps his thoughts will reveal what his lips won't.

SharranInformer_86.speaker: Ferg Drogher
SharranInformer_86.text: Fool. Think anyone will miss you if you vanish in a place like this? Let's find out...
SharranInformer_86.context: NodeContext: Aggressive (player was caught trying to read his mind) combat ensues after

SharranInformer_8.speaker: Ferg Drogher
SharranInformer_8.text: Difficult to get a good day's trade done when I'm expected to keep watch for Shadowheart at the same time. Who knows when she'll finally turn up?

SharranInformer_81.speaker: Player
SharranInformer_81.text: That's despicable conduct - you should aid the needy, not exploit them.

SharranInformer_15.speaker: Ferg Drogher
SharranInformer_15.text: Why, I am aiding them. They gain both the gold they need, and lose the material desires weighing them down.

SharranInformer_98.speaker: Halsin
SharranInformer_98.text: Even carrion birds would not stoop so low.

SharranInformer_13.speaker: Ferg Drogher
SharranInformer_13.text: It is a most welcome absence, in my estimation.
SharranInformer_13.context: NodeContext: absence said with relish here

SharranInformer_21.speaker: Narrator
SharranInformer_21.text: *The phrase 'welcome absence' catches in your mind - it is the refrain of a popular Sharran hymn.*

SharranInformer_74.speaker: Player
SharranInformer_74.text: A tithe must always be paid - no matter how harsh. Such is life.

SharranInformer_66.speaker: Ferg Drogher
SharranInformer_66.text: Hear hear. Though I'd keep your speech low, friend - not many share our outlook on the matter.

SharranInformer_26.speaker: Player
SharranInformer_26.text: Sounds like you've got wares for sale. Mind if I take a look?

SharranInformer_54.speaker: Ferg Drogher
SharranInformer_54.text: Welcome. You see to peruse the special goods, I take it?

SharranInformer_85.speaker: Ferg Drogher
SharranInformer_85.text: Back again? It is nice to converse with someone who isn't circling the drain, like this lot. Looking on their maudlin faces does sap my spirits...
SharranInformer_85.context: NodeContext: Referring the refugees present in the general area around him

Protester_002_0.speaker: Mandii Harvestmoon
Protester_002_0.text: Between you and me, I don't think there are enough Flaming Fist here for these refugees.

Protester_002_2.speaker: Player
Protester_002_2.text: I agree - there aren't nearly enough folk helping the refugees.

Protester_002_14.speaker: Mandii Harvestmoon
Protester_002_14.text: Ah, no, you misunderstand. I mean... anyone could be among these 'refugees'.

Protester_002_5.speaker: Mandii Harvestmoon
Protester_002_5.text: Us Baldurians can't feel safe with so many of them roaming about without proper supervision.

Protester_002_13.speaker: Player
Protester_002_13.text: You're right. The lifestyle of all Baldurians is at risk.

Protester_002_9.speaker: Player
Protester_002_9.text: It is a shame so many fail to follow the light and help each other these days.

Protester_002_3.speaker: Mandii Harvestmoon
Protester_002_3.text: You're quite right. Nobody helps us regular folk of Baldur's Gate anymore.

Protester_002_4.speaker: Mandii Harvestmoon
Protester_002_4.text: Too busy coddling the criminals and their ilk that sneak into our city.

Protester_002_7.speaker: Mandii Harvestmoon
Protester_002_7.text: With Lord Gortash killed - probably by troublemakers like these - we can't afford to let our guards down.

Protester_002_6.speaker: Mandii Harvestmoon
