Protester_002_6.text: Let's hope Archduke Gortash can make a difference.

Protester_002_11.speaker: Mandii Harvestmoon
Protester_002_11.text: I'd certainly feel a lot safer if they brought a few Steel Watch down here to keep these 'refugees' in check.

Protester_002_12.speaker: Mandii Harvestmoon
Protester_002_12.text: I heard the explosion - this never would've happened if we had some Steel Watchers here!
Protester_002_12.context: NodeContext: Panicked (but still confident in the Steel Watch)

Protester_002_16.speaker: Mandii Harvestmoon
Protester_002_16.text: Flaming Fist is right - the whole barn will burn down next if they don't get a handle on the troublemakers here!
Protester_002_16.context: NodeContext: Still panicked but scornful of the Flaming Fist

FlamingFist_003_3.speaker: Fist Broadhorn
FlamingFist_003_3.text: Manip Nestor may have given you the benefit of the doubt but I've got my eye on you, make no mistake.
FlamingFist_003_3.context: NodeContext: Wary of the player's motives

FlamingFist_003_4.speaker: Fist Broadhorn
FlamingFist_003_4.text: A repeat offender, is it? Prison's the best place for you, it seems.
FlamingFist_003_4.context: NodeContext: A little disappointed in the player

FlamingFist_003_10.speaker: Player
FlamingFist_003_10.text: Allow yourself to be taken to prison.

FlamingFist_003_5.speaker: Fist Broadhorn
FlamingFist_003_5.text: Just wanted to say I'm rather impressed with your work - you'd make a solid Flaming Fist.

FlamingFist_003_7.speaker: Fist Broadhorn
FlamingFist_003_7.text: Halt there! You know this area's restricted - maybe you'll remember better after a spell in the cells.
FlamingFist_003_7.context: NodeContext: Angry at the player's law breaking

FlamingFist_003_8.speaker: Fist Broadhorn
FlamingFist_003_8.text: Halt, citizen! This is a restricted area - explain yourself.
FlamingFist_003_8.context: NodeContext: Stern and forceful; clearly loves her job

FlamingFist_003_0.speaker: Player
FlamingFist_003_0.text: There's something dangerous in the donations - I need to investigate.

FlamingFist_003_19.speaker: Fist Broadhorn
FlamingFist_003_19.text: And I'm the Duke's bed warmer. Follow me, please - Manip Nestor'll know what to do with you.

FlamingFist_003_2.speaker: Player
FlamingFist_003_2.text: I just wanted to see what was inside this barn - no funny business.

FlamingFist_003_12.speaker: Fist Broadhorn
FlamingFist_003_12.text: Funny enough for me to take you to Manip Nestor, I think - come on.

FlamingFist_003_16.speaker: Player
FlamingFist_003_16.text: I was looking to see if there was anything worth stealing.

FlamingFist_003_14.speaker: Fist Broadhorn
FlamingFist_003_14.text: Thank you - honesty is the best policy. Let's go and have a chat with Manip Nestor, hm?
FlamingFist_003_14.context: NodeContext: Genuinely pleased the player owned up

FlamingFist_003_9.speaker: Fist Broadhorn
FlamingFist_003_9.text: Explosives in toys... How despicable. Hope Lord Gortash gets this stuff sorted out.

FlamingFist_003_13.speaker: Fist Broadhorn
FlamingFist_003_13.text: I'll be following you crime-solving career with great interest, friend.

FlamingFist_003_18.speaker: Fist Broadhorn
FlamingFist_003_18.text: I hear you've been given permission to be here - don't disappoint me.
FlamingFist_003_18.context: NodeContext: Slightly wary of the player's motives

Refugee_08_0.speaker: Garron Flintsplitter
Refugee_08_0.text: Actually got here safely, towing along my wife, sister, and mother! Or maybe they towed me along, eh?

Refugee_08_1.speaker: Garron Flintsplitter
Refugee_08_1.text: We made it this far, me and my ladies. I wish I could see a way forward from here. 'Can't dig a mine if you don't know where to stick your pick.'

AD_TraineeKids_2.speaker: Ide
AD_TraineeKids_2.text: ...When Alfira sang us that song? I think of it every day.

AD_TraineeKids_1.speaker: Umi
AD_TraineeKids_1.text: Me too. I hope she's all right.

AD_TraineeKids_6.speaker: Umi
AD_TraineeKids_6.text: You know who always smelled nice?

AD_TraineeKids_5.speaker: Ide
AD_TraineeKids_5.text: Yeah, I know. Alfira. No matter where we were.

AD_TraineeKids_3.speaker: Umi
AD_TraineeKids_3.text: I wonder how she did it. I mean, Cerys was always filthy. Like us.

AD_TraineeKids_8.speaker: Ide
AD_TraineeKids_8.text: How did that song go, anyway? Dee-dee-dee-dum-dee...

AD_TraineeKids_4.speaker: Umi
AD_TraineeKids_4.text: Sorry, Ide, but you're no bard.

AD_TraineeKids_7.speaker: Ide
AD_TraineeKids_7.text: Oh, yeah? Well, you smell like... like poop.

AD_RefugeeChild_04_0.speaker: Billy
AD_RefugeeChild_04_0.text: Come baaaack! You're all too fast! I'll never tag you...

AD_FlamingFistManip_GivesInstructions_4.speaker: Manip Nestor
AD_FlamingFistManip_GivesInstructions_4.text: One more dereliction of duty and you're all going on punishment detail. Got it?

AD_FlamingFistManip_GivesInstructions_2.speaker: Manip Nestor
AD_FlamingFistManip_GivesInstructions_2.text: This isn't a glorious post, Fists, but it isn't a hard one, either.

AD_FlamingFistManip_GivesInstructions_0.speaker: Manip Nestor
AD_FlamingFistManip_GivesInstructions_0.text: If you can't even guard a blasted shed, it's no wonder we're being replaced by Steel Watchers.

AD_FlamingFistManip_GivesInstructions_3.speaker: Manip Nestor
AD_FlamingFistManip_GivesInstructions_3.text: Double the patrols. We're dealing with a maniac here.

Refugee_13_0.speaker: Ramona Flintsplitter
Refugee_13_0.text: Sorry to burden you like that before. I should just try to remember the good days, before we had to leave Boareskyr.

Refugee_13_1.speaker: Ramona Flintsplitter
Refugee_13_1.text: My son Garron is pleased we got this far together, but his wife's bitching is making me old before my time. Why can't he tell her to put a sock in it?

BackupLeader_1.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader_1.text: What a sad situation - the once proud tieflings of Elturel reduced to beggars.

FlamingFist_002_6.speaker: Fist Poole
FlamingFist_002_6.text: Go poke around in the barn, then - isn't that what you wanted?

FlamingFist_002_7.speaker: Fist Poole
FlamingFist_002_7.text: Stop right there, you! I've got a prison cell with your name on it.
FlamingFist_002_7.context: NodeContext: Angry; the player is really pushing their luck now

FlamingFist_002_8.speaker: Fist Poole
FlamingFist_002_8.text: Glad to hear you did something useful - I'm almost impressed.

FlamingFist_002_10.speaker: Fist Poole
FlamingFist_002_10.text: I can see you over there, you know. What are you doing?

FlamingFist_002_1.speaker: Player
FlamingFist_002_1.text: There's dangerous things in here I need to investigate!

FlamingFist_002_22.speaker: Fist Poole
FlamingFist_002_22.text: I bet there are. Come on - let's see what Nestor thinks about these 'dangerous things'.
FlamingFist_002_22.context: NodeContext: Clearly doesn't believe the player; sarcastic

FlamingFist_002_2.speaker: Player
FlamingFist_002_2.text: Just taking a peek inside this barn, is all - I didn't realise it wasn't allowed.

FlamingFist_002_5.speaker: Fist Poole
FlamingFist_002_5.text: It is not. But I'll let Nestor teach you the rules.

FlamingFist_002_16.speaker: Player
FlamingFist_002_16.text: All right, all right - you got me. Now what?

FlamingFist_002_4.speaker: Fist Poole
FlamingFist_002_4.text: We go and have a little chat with Nestor. Well, you do.

FlamingFist_002_11.speaker: Player
FlamingFist_002_11.text: Attack before he raises the alarm.

FlamingFist_002_13.speaker: Fist Poole
FlamingFist_002_13.text: Stop stinking up my air, would you?

FlamingFist_002_15.speaker: Fist Poole
FlamingFist_002_15.text: I said I was almost impressed - what more do you want from me?

FlamingFist_002_17.speaker: Fist Poole
FlamingFist_002_17.text: Glad Nestor sorted out those trapped toys - nasty business, that.

FlamingFist_002_18.speaker: Fist Poole
FlamingFist_002_18.text: Nestor let you in? Good. Means you'll be further away from me.

FlamingFist_002_19.speaker: Fist Poole
FlamingFist_002_19.text: Back again? Did you not learn the first time? Right - off to the cells with you.
FlamingFist_002_19.context: NodeContext: Angry; the player is really pushing their luck now

FlamingFist_002_3.speaker: Player
FlamingFist_002_3.text: Allow yourself to be taken to prison.

FlamingFist_002_20.speaker: Fist Poole
FlamingFist_002_20.text: If you wanna chat, talk to Nestor - I like my personal space.

AD_WoundedRefugeeFriends_0.speaker: Gregory Bright
AD_WoundedRefugeeFriends_0.text: Gronch isn't looking so good, Neal.

AD_WoundedRefugeeFriends_2.speaker: Nealos Bright
AD_WoundedRefugeeFriends_2.text: I know, but we need to get into the city.

AD_WoundedRefugeeFriends_1.speaker: Gregory Bright
AD_WoundedRefugeeFriends_1.text: Can't leave Gronch behind, though. Just can't.

AD_WoundedRefugeeFriends_6.speaker: Gregory Bright
AD_WoundedRefugeeFriends_6.text: We owe Gronch a lot, Neal.

AD_WoundedRefugeeFriends_5.speaker: Nealos Bright
AD_WoundedRefugeeFriends_5.text: I guess we could call our lives 'a lot'.

AD_WoundedRefugeeFriends_3.speaker: Gregory Bright
AD_WoundedRefugeeFriends_3.text: I'm not leaving him here. Not for any reason.

AD_WoundedRefugeeFriends_8.speaker: Nealos Bright
AD_WoundedRefugeeFriends_8.text: Even if we got Gronch into the city with us, what would he do there?

AD_WoundedRefugeeFriends_4.speaker: Gregory Bright
AD_WoundedRefugeeFriends_4.text: Oh, I think he can look out for himself once he's healed.

AD_WoundedRefugeeFriends_7.speaker: Nealos Bright
AD_WoundedRefugeeFriends_7.text: Then I guess he'd better get well, and soon.

DibbsWife_1.speaker: Grisselda Dibbs
DibbsWife_1.text: Maybe I'll get a cat when we make it into the Lower City. That'll show him.

DibbsWife_3.speaker: Grisselda Dibbs
DibbsWife_3.text: I apologise for my husband and his... obsession with that bloody dog.

HobgoblinOutcast_0.speaker: Toadbreath
HobgoblinOutcast_0.text: Whut? I'm bushed. I ran for days to get to someplace safe, and then found out I'm last in line to get in. 'Cause I'm a hobgoblin.

HobgoblinOutcast_1.speaker: Toadbreath
HobgoblinOutcast_1.text: As if I could change that.

HobgoblinOutcast_2.speaker: Toadbreath
HobgoblinOutcast_2.text: Let me be. It seems my only friend is sleep.

AD_PickpocketAndCharmedKids_0.speaker: Mattis
AD_PickpocketAndCharmedKids_0.text: What do you think that clerk has got in his crate?

AD_PickpocketAndCharmedKids_1.speaker: Mattis
AD_PickpocketAndCharmedKids_1.text: Nah, I bet that's where he keeps the valuables.

AD_PickpocketAndCharmedKids_6.speaker: Mattis
AD_PickpocketAndCharmedKids_6.text: We need a place to hide any good stuff we find.

AD_PickpocketAndCharmedKids_5.speaker: Mirkon
AD_PickpocketAndCharmedKids_5.text: How about in those stacks of hay?

AD_PickpocketAndCharmedKids_3.speaker: Mattis
AD_PickpocketAndCharmedKids_3.text: You've had worse ideas, Mirkon. A lot worse.

AD_PickpocketAndCharmedKids_8.speaker: Mirkon
AD_PickpocketAndCharmedKids_8.text: How come all the grown-ups look at me sideways?

AD_PickpocketAndCharmedKids_4.speaker: Mattis
AD_PickpocketAndCharmedKids_4.text: Because they think you're a thief, Mirkon. Duh.

AD_PickpocketAndCharmedKids_7.speaker: Mirkon
AD_PickpocketAndCharmedKids_7.text: But I'm not a thief. Am I? Wish I could ask Mol.

Refugee_03_1.speaker: Zindra Manne
Refugee_03_1.text: Do I have to spell it out? Your. Own. Business. Mind it.

PAD_RecoveredRing_0.speaker: Player
PAD_RecoveredRing_0.text: Part of a ring. Looks like it combines with that other broken piece from before.

AD_RefugeeChild_03_0.speaker: Bobby
AD_RefugeeChild_03_0.text: Faster - ahahaha - CAN'T CATCH ME! Faster!

Refugee_14_0.speaker: Gregory Bright
Refugee_14_0.text: When Nealos and me were hiding and hungry and scared, it was Gronch who got us through. I'm not letting him down now.

Refugee_14_1.speaker: Gregory Bright
Refugee_14_1.text: Don't know how we're going to get Gronch into the city, wounded as he is. But we have to.

Tiefling_011_7.speaker: Zorru
Tiefling_011_7.text: So, you survived. That's more than many of my kin can say.

Tiefling_011_1.speaker: Player
Tiefling_011_1.text: At least you made it. How are you holding up?

Tiefling_011_51.speaker: Zorru
Tiefling_011_51.text: It's mainly anger that keeps me going. Zevlor was supposed to lead us, but he froze when we needed him most.

Tiefling_011_22.speaker: Zorru
Tiefling_011_22.text: I haven't seen him since the massacre on the road. Which is lucky for him.

Tiefling_011_36.speaker: Player
Tiefling_011_36.text: Zevlor is dead - murdered. His severed head was sent to my camp.

Tiefling_011_42.speaker: Zorru
Tiefling_011_42.text: He's dead? Then there's some justice in the world, after all.

Tiefling_011_50.speaker: Player
Tiefling_011_50.text: I spoke with him before his death. He felt he had no choice but to act as he did.

Tiefling_011_52.speaker: Zorru
Tiefling_011_52.text: No choice? We could have fought, and would have if he'd led the way. We might have lost, but it was a chance. Surrendering was certain death.

Tiefling_011_18.speaker: Player
Tiefling_011_18.text: It's easy to second-guess a leader afterwards. At the time, he hoped to avoid a massacre.

Tiefling_011_45.speaker: Zorru
Tiefling_011_45.text: It's not too much to ask a leader to lead. When the crisis came, he failed us.

Tiefling_011_32.speaker: Player
Tiefling_011_32.text: A leader makes the hard decisions so you don't have to. You owe Zevlor a debt.

Tiefling_011_6.speaker: Player
Tiefling_011_6.text: For taking those matters of life and death on himself. That burden weighed on his conscience instead of yours.

Tiefling_011_38.speaker: Zorru
Tiefling_011_38.text: Those are... just words. I'm talking about lives. Go away and leave me to my grief.

Tiefling_011_53.speaker: Player
Tiefling_011_53.text: He led you, fought for you, and ultimately died for you.

Tiefling_011_21.speaker: Zorru
Tiefling_011_21.text: Spare me your sanctimony. He died a failure, with the blood of the tieflings he should have protected on his hands.

Tiefling_011_9.speaker: Player
Tiefling_011_9.text: He made a mistake. Everyone does, now and then.

Tiefling_011_17.speaker: Zorru
Tiefling_011_17.text: His mistake cost lives - tieflings died who should be alive today. I can't forgive that.

Tiefling_011_14.speaker: Player
Tiefling_011_14.text: He was afraid for your lives and made a frightened man's decision.

Tiefling_011_2.speaker: Zorru
Tiefling_011_2.text: He was weak. He broke, and made a broken man's decision. And we all suffered for it.

Tiefling_011_34.speaker: Player
Tiefling_011_34.text: I spoke to him before his death. He admitted his failure, but had no convincing explanation for his surrender.

Tiefling_011_28.speaker: Zorru
Tiefling_011_28.text: None is possible. At least now he's paid for his betrayal.

Tiefling_011_11.speaker: Player
Tiefling_011_11.text: What did Zevlor do that makes you say that?

Tiefling_011_4.speaker: Zorru
Tiefling_011_4.text: Oh, he deserves it. Trust me.

Tiefling_011_3.speaker: Zorru
Tiefling_011_3.text: We were in a bad place and walked into an ambush. Our only options were fight or surrender.

Tiefling_011_19.speaker: Zorru
Tiefling_011_19.text: Zevlor froze. I shook him, demanded orders, answers, but he just stared at me.

Tiefling_011_46.speaker: Zorru
Tiefling_011_46.text: When the attackers closed in, he woke up - and told our fighters to stand down.

Tiefling_011_48.speaker: Zorru
Tiefling_011_48.text: He wouldn't fight, so we did what he said and surrendered. They rounded us up and marched us to Moonrise.

Tiefling_011_54.speaker: Zorru
Tiefling_011_54.text: Most of us never marched out again.

Tiefling_011_37.speaker: Player
Tiefling_011_37.text: No wonder you're furious. I'm furious just hearing about it.

Tiefling_011_23.speaker: Zorru
Tiefling_011_23.text: For all the good that does either of us. And now you say Zevlor's dead. Well, I say good riddance.

Tiefling_011_8.speaker: Player
Tiefling_011_8.text: I am sorry. It sounds like Zevlor was just overwhelmed.

Tiefling_011_13.speaker: Zorru
Tiefling_011_13.text: No need for you to apologise. The news of his death is some consolation, at least. Though not much.

Tiefling_011_5.speaker: Player
Tiefling_011_5.text: I wanted to ask you about Zevlor.

Tiefling_011_33.speaker: Zorru
Tiefling_011_33.text: That loser? Don't bother. I don't even want to think about him after what he did.

Tiefling_011_43.speaker: Player
Tiefling_011_43.text: I wanted to ask you about Zevlor.

Tiefling_011_30.speaker: Zorru
Tiefling_011_30.text: It's all right, I'm not mad about it anymore. He tried his best to lead us in a terrible situation. I see that now.

Tiefling_011_12.speaker: Zorru
Tiefling_011_12.text: I'm not in the mood. Leave me alone.

Tiefling_011_31.speaker: Zorru
Tiefling_011_31.text: I have nothing more to say to you. Leave me to mourn our dead.

Tiefling_011_41.speaker: Zorru
Tiefling_011_41.text: What do you make of those protestors?

Tiefling_011_44.speaker: Player
Tiefling_011_44.text: I think they're grabbing the wrong end of the rothé.

Tiefling_011_39.speaker: Zorru
Tiefling_011_39.text: Ha! A jest is welcome in times like these. I'm Zorru.

Tiefling_011_47.speaker: Player
Tiefling_011_47.text: Reactions like that are inevitable. People are afraid.

Tiefling_011_0.speaker: Zorru
Tiefling_011_0.text: A philosopher... Who could've thought. Name's Zorru.

Tiefling_011_24.speaker: Zorru
Tiefling_011_24.text: I heard about you. You're the one that helped us with the goblins.

Tiefling_011_25.speaker: Zorru
Tiefling_011_25.text: You know most of us didn't make it, right? Zevlor failed us.

Tiefling_011_10.speaker: Player
Tiefling_011_10.text: They may have a point. The city can't handle all these refugees.

Tiefling_011_26.speaker: Zorru
Tiefling_011_26.text: Really? Then we have nothing to say to each other.

Refugee_12_0.speaker: Gizelle Flintsplitter
Refugee_12_0.text: Can't figure out how Garron puts up with her. Maybe she treats him special in the sack - no, Gizelle! Don't think about it!

Refugee_12_1.speaker: Gizelle Flintsplitter
Refugee_12_1.text: Can't stand her can't stand her can't stand her! My sister-in-law: all law and no sister. Grr!

WoundedRefugee_2.speaker: Gronch
WoundedRefugee_2.text: Just between you and me, this pretending-to-be-wounded thing is getting old.

WoundedRefugee_14.speaker: Gronch
WoundedRefugee_14.text: Aghkk! Whatever you need, I can't help you. Even talking is painful right now.
WoundedRefugee_14.context: NodeContext: quite over the top - pretending to be wounded

WoundedRefugee_12.speaker: Gronch
WoundedRefugee_12.text: Some goblin cultists were about to stumble on where those two Bright boys were hiding. So I just kind of drew their attention.

WoundedRefugee_8.speaker: Gronch
WoundedRefugee_8.text: The Bright boys got away, but I took a hit killing those gobbos, and it's taking it's time healing. Thanks for asking, though.

WoundedRefugee_18.speaker: Player
WoundedRefugee_18.text: Let me take a look at that wound.

WoundedRefugee_11.speaker: Narrator
WoundedRefugee_11.text: *After a quick examination, you conclude that your patient is pretending to be wounded. You wonder why.*

WoundedRefugee_20.speaker: Gronch
WoundedRefugee_20.text: Really. This isn't necessary. I'm sure there are other people here that need your help more urgently.

WoundedRefugee_17.speaker: Player
WoundedRefugee_17.text: This is barely a scratch. What's the idea?

WoundedRefugee_5.speaker: Player
WoundedRefugee_5.text: The fake wound grift is a classic, but you need to put more effort in.

WoundedRefugee_16.speaker: Gronch
WoundedRefugee_16.text: Shh, not so loud! If those lads find out I'm faking, they might go off on their own. They're not ready for that. And frankly, I'd miss them.

WoundedRefugee_0.speaker: Gronch
WoundedRefugee_0.text: I don't really have any other friends, and I like those lads. So I think I'll stick around a while more.

WoundedRefugee_6.speaker: Gronch
WoundedRefugee_6.text: Don't worry about my 'wound' - it gives me a reason to keep an eye on those tanglefoot Bright lads. I'd like to keep them out of trouble.

WoundedRefugee_19.speaker: Player
WoundedRefugee_19.text: I'm well versed in healing rites - allow me to take a look.

AD_FlamingFistManip_AfterToys_0.speaker: Manip Nestor
AD_FlamingFistManip_AfterToys_0.text: Toys, trapped to injure children - it's abominable!

AD_FlamingFistManip_AfterToys_1.speaker: Manip Nestor
AD_FlamingFistManip_AfterToys_1.text: Who would do such a thing?

AD_FlamingFistManip_AfterToys_2.speaker: Manip Nestor
AD_FlamingFistManip_AfterToys_2.text: I thought this assignment was going to be dull. No such luck.

FlamingFist_004_0.speaker: Fist Lochan
FlamingFist_004_0.context: NodeContext: Distracted/annoyed; trying to wrangle anti-refugee protestors and the player is interrupting

FlamingFist_004_1.speaker: Fist Lochan
FlamingFist_004_1.text: Thank you for your help with those toys. Gods only know what could have happened if you hadn't stepped in.

FlamingFist_004_2.speaker: Fist Lochan
FlamingFist_004_2.text: Since you sorted that out, perhaps 'well-meaning' bigots like our friends here will show a little more sympathy.

FlamingFist_004_3.speaker: Fist Lochan
FlamingFist_004_3.context: NodeContext: Annoyed/distracted; has more important things on their mind

FlamingFist_004_4.speaker: Fist Lochan
FlamingFist_004_4.text: Thanks for trying to talk some sense into them. For all the good it did.

FlamingFist_004_7.speaker: Fist Lochan
FlamingFist_004_7.context: NodeContext: Weary/annoyed; trying to wrangle anti-refugee protestors and the player is interrupting

FlamingFist_004_5.speaker: Fist Lochan
FlamingFist_004_5.text: Go talk to Nestor if you must - I've got plenty on my plate with these mewling geese.
FlamingFist_004_5.context: NodeContext: Weary/annoyed; trying to wrangle anti-refugee protestors and the player is interrupting

FlamingFist_004_8.speaker: Fist Lochan
FlamingFist_004_8.text: Get on with you - I've got plenty on my plate with these mewling geese.
FlamingFist_004_8.context: NodeContext: Weary/annoyed; trying to wrangle anti-refugee protestors and the player is interrupting

FlamingFist_004_9.speaker: Fist Lochan
FlamingFist_004_9.text: Children's toys rigged to explode? Just when you think you've seen the worst people can do, something like this happens.

Dead_MurderVictim_17.speaker: Narrator
Dead_MurderVictim_17.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

Dead_MurderVictim_12.speaker: Player
Dead_MurderVictim_12.text: Do you have any next of kin?

Dead_MurderVictim_1.speaker: Player
Dead_MurderVictim_1.text: What's the last thing you remember?

Dead_MurderVictim_8.speaker: Dead Refugee
Dead_MurderVictim_8.text: Man... buying heirlooms... vulture. Challenged him...

Dead_MurderVictim_5.speaker: Player
Dead_MurderVictim_5.text: Tell me about the gemless ring I found with you.

Dead_MurderVictim_4.speaker: Dead Refugee
Dead_MurderVictim_4.text: Brother's... died on the road... man tried to buy...

Dead_MurderVictim_21.speaker: Narrator
Dead_MurderVictim_21.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

Dead_MurderVictim_22.speaker: Narrator
Dead_MurderVictim_22.text: *The corpse seems willing to speak - but not to its killer.*
